La familia de Nancy  tiene un negocio de confecciones  fabrican sabanas y cortinas  ella  trabaja  en la sección corte y a la vez dirige al personal que allí labora, las ganancias que obtiene por su trabajo las ahorra por que su mayor anhelo es  comprarse un terreno para construir su propia casa  y acondicionar un lugar para dedicarse a la venta de comidas con su propio restaurante.
Nancy  es la presidenta del grupo “SANTA ROSA” ya lleva en el cargo 2 años, son 10 socias todas  vecinas del mismo lugar, su préstamo  reciente  lo usara para empezar a vender  algunos platos típicos  y así  emprender su  sueño de tener su restaurante ella sabe que en futuro le ira muy bien por que tiene muchas amistades que disfrutan de su sazón. 

*La Sra., Nancy es la primera de las sentadas esta con buzo negro
texts.en:
Nancy’s family owns a business that manufactures bed linens and curtains. She is responsible for cutting the material as well as managing the staff who work there. Her greatest wish is to use her savings and the revenue generated from her business to buy a plot of land for building her own house and opening a restaurant where she can sell food.

Nancy is the President of the “Santa Rosa” Group and was elected to this position two years ago. The group has ten members who are all neighbors from the same area. Her most recent loan will be used to start selling traditional dishes since her dream is have her own restaurant. She knows that she will do well in the future because she has many friends who enjoy her cooking.

*Sra. Nancy is the first person seated wearing a black pullover.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies to start a food business

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: El Sr. A. A. Julian, vive en la urbanización Sebastían Barranca B-14, perteneciente al Distrito de Santiago. Tiene a cargo a su madre quien es viuda . Trabaja como obrero de campo  en  Agrícola Chapi desde hace 2 años. Cuenta con casa propia a la cual le esta realizando acabados. Solicita el financiamiento para realizar acabados a su vivienda a fin de poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su madre. El Sr. A. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Julian A. A. lives in the neighborhood of Sebastían Barranca B-14, which is part of the district of Santiago. He looks after his mother who is a widow. Julian has been working as a field laborer on the Chapi Farm for two years. He has his own house and is making the final touches.

Julian is requesting a loan so that he can complete the finishing touches to his home so that he can provide his mother a better quality of life. He is grateful for the support that has been provided with this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Complete the finishing touches to his house

loans.name: Chanthoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthoeun U. (shown in the picture), and her husband, Mr. Chanthol Thorn, have been married for almost two years and just have a young daughter. The family lives in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Chanthoeun sells soup and pickled fruits at her home. She used to be a hairdresser as well. Her husband has been a motorbike repairer for more than five years. He runs the business at his own shop next to his house. 

Chanthoeun is asking for a loan in the amount of US $600 to pay for school fees for her brother who is in his third year of banking. She also will use a part of the loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for school fees for her brother

loans.name: Donna Mae

texts.en: Donna Mae P. is a married woman who lives in Proper, Barangay Gen. Malvar, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a rice-retailing business. Her husband, Rogelio P., who is 44 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are from 10 to 16 years old. Donna Mae joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, thus uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 5th loan, Donna Mae is borrowing PHP 11,000 which she intends to use to buy rice and additional items for her general store so that she can continue to save for future home repairs and for the education of her children. Donna Mae is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy more rice and additional items for her general store

loans.name: Mobateli Plus Group

texts.en:
Freddy is the chairman of a community bank named “Mobateli Plus”, which is composed of 19 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Freddy is 32 years old and single. He runs a telephone booth, a beauty shop and sells beverages. He started selling beverages in 2005 with a beginning capital of $50. With hard work and determination, his business prospered and he diversified by opening a telephone booth and a beauty shop. 

His businesses are located in the heart of the city of Kinshasa. He has already received five loans from Hope DRC and repaid them correctly. Freddy intends with the next loan to purchase a freezer and 30 prepaid cards. He will also use the loan as working capital to increase his inventory.

He makes $60 profit each week. His ambition is to open a drugstore in his area.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and prepaid cards and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REAL”; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Beatriz; ella tiene 42 años de edad y la socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista; La socia  prepara refrigerios y comidas suaves en su casa para hacer box lunch para turistas y jardines para niños, la socia tiene contrata con diferentes agencias de viajes y aventura, ella prepara diversas variedades de almuerzos fríos para llevar a los diversos tours que se ofrece en la ciudad del Cusco; ella es la encargada de ofrecer una gama de alternativas vegetarianas y platillos peruanos, también postres y refrigerios menores para los tours. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para su negocio.

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “REAL” ["Royal"] communal bank. She lives in the district of Santiago, in the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Beatriz, and she is 42 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She divides her time between her household activities and her retail business. She prepares refrigerated platters and simple foods in her home to make box lunches for tourists and child care centers. She has contracts with various travel agencies and tour programs, and she prepares diverse kinds of cold lunches for participants in the various tours offered in the city of Cusco. She is the one they rely upon to offer a range of vegetarian alternatives and Peruvian dishes, as well as desserts and snack plates for the tours. She is requesting the loan to buy supplies for her business. Beatriz values and appreciates the loan granted to her, since it will permit her to expand her business and have a better quality of life; accordingly, she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies for her business

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
José Guadalupe Vázquez R. es un hombre muy trabajador que esta pendiente de la comodidad de su familia; es por ello que quiere terminar de construir un cuarto que con ahorros propios ha ido levantando pero en este momento el quiere un préstamo para comprar mas material y pagar mano de obra para su proyecto se realice.
José quedo viudo lo cual recibe pensión por sus 4 hijos y también el quedo deshabilitado lo cual no puede trabajar pero recibe su pago cada mes.
texts.en:
José Guadalupe V. R. is a hard-working man that is mindful of his family's comfort. Because of this he wants to finish the construction of a bedroom that he started with his own savings. At this time he would like a loan to buy more materials and to pay for labor to do the project. José is a widower and receives financial support for his 4 children since he is disabled and can't work. He receives his payment monthly.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials and to pay for labor

loans.name: Dewi Fortuna Group

texts.en: Jero P. S. is a 32-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali. She is the group leader of this eleven-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Dewi Fortuna (PK-10295). Jero P. S. is married and has two adult children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month. In 2010, Jero P. S. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. The loan will be her first from MUK. Jero P. S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. ***************************************************** Jero P. S. 0 (0) merupakan 32 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Jero P. S. adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 11 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Dewi Fortuna (PK-10295). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Jero P. S. sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Jero P. S. menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR. Dalam 2010, Jero P. S. bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Jero P. S. meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a 61-year-old mother of three who lives with her husband and children in Barrio Cuba, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. Antonia is a busy entrepreneur; she has a business selling clothes that she makes as well as various catalog items. In the picture, you can see Antonia with the products she sells. 

In Costa Rica, many workers receive a bonus in December in the form of an extra salary payment. For example, if normally a person receives two deposits per month (for the same amount) he/she will receive a third deposit in December. Antonia would like to stock up on inventory items in order to be able to satisfy the anticipated surge in demand for her products in the coming months. As a result, Antonia hopes to use this loan to invest in various catalog items such as shoes, perfume and kitchen wear, as well as sewing materials (thread, needles). Antonia says that business has been good recently and that now is an excellent time for her to look for sources of working capital. 

Antonia organizes her day in accordance with a strict schedule. In the mornings, she wakes up early to prepare breakfast and lunch for her husband and children. She also carries out various domestic responsibilities during this time. In the afternoons, she dedicates her time to her business, making sales, collecting payments and sewing. 

Antonia also relies on the assistance of her daughter, who makes sales to her colleagues at work. Antonia´s main goal is to increase her clientele and to be able to offer a more diverse range of products to her clients.  Her only obstacle is a lack of working capital.

loans.use: For the purchase of shoes, perfume, clothes and sewing materials

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros B. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 50 years old and married. To make a living, she owns and operates a  specialized retail store, selling health, wellness and medicinal products and also different kinds of food products like instant noodles in the local community. Milagros has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $225 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Milagros joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milagros is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Flora Mila

texts.es:
Flora de 56 años, hace decoraciones y vende bebidas y snack en una pequeña tienda, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciales informales). 

Hace años atrás ella vivía en una casa muy humilde casi metida en el agua de un estero, comenzó a trabajar con un congelador vendiendo bebidas, poco a poco con dedicación pudo completar dinero para arreglar su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene una pequeña tienda y trabaja haciendo adornos de telas, hilos. Trabaja en la tienda y en el tiempo que le queda o que no abre la tienda se dedica hacer las decoración que le piden desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas para hacer mas decoraciones y tener un negocio establecido de decoraciones. En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y tene el negocio de decoraciones.
texts.en:
Flora is 56 years old and she makes decorations and sells refreshments and snacks in a small store. She lives in the Guasmo de Guayaquil (an urban area, the majority of the inhabitants are informal merchants).

Some years back, she lived in a very humble home almost in a watery inlet. Flora began working with a freezer selling refreshments and little by little, with a lot of dedication, she was able to save enough money to improve her home. At the moment, she has a small store and works making decorations out of fabrics and thread. Flora works in the store and in the time that she has left or when she doesn’t open the store, she makes decorations which are ordered from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm.

With the loan, Flora wants to buy fabrics to make more decorations and to have a business based on her decorations.

In the future Flora wants to improve her home and her decorating business.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, threads.

loans.name: Samson Oreu

texts.en:
Samson Oreu K., age 36, is a maize farmer. He cultivates this crop because the area is known for producing good, fertile maize. He and his wife Evaline live in Osupuko village in Kilgoris Town with their four children: Naserian, age 13, Ledama, age 11, Napamei, age nine, and Lanei, age seven.

Samson has just harvested his crops, so he is in need of more maize seeds to plant. He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by a friend who is a client here. The profits made will be used to cater to the family needs.

His desire is to see his business grow and be able to employ people to help him run the business.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds for planting in the next season

loans.name: Hurelhuyag

texts.en:
Hurelhuyag T. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Uvs province, Mongolia.  He and his family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home, in the  yard of the organization where he works as a guard. The family lost their home to a fire in 2008 but the couple is working very hard to establish their home again. His wife works as a cleaner in a local grocery shop.

Hurelhuyag has been making wooden ger frames such as walls, ceilings, etc., for the past 20 years and has gained a lot of experience as a craftsman. He usually produces wooden ger frames with 5, 6, or 8 walls according to his customers' orders. Last summer, he made 20 ger frames. His son helps him to produce his wooden products.

 After many years of owing this business, he has built up a stable and successful operation and his earnings have enabled him to pay his daughter's tuition fees. In the future, as he continues support his family, he hopes to grow his business further by producing not only ger frames but also ger furniture. 

Hurelhuyag is a hardworking man and says, "I try to live well without falling into the difficulties and barriers of life." He is requesting a 450,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood and supplies for his ger frame-making business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and supplies

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica B. lives in Nakulabye, the neighborhood of Kampala City.  She is married and has 8 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (two in-laws).  Monica has a business selling local gin.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Monica sells her products in a wholesale shop.  

Monica has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more jerycans of local gin.  The main business challenges for Monica include thieves and the rainy season which hinders her customers from reaching her.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to Kabarole for local gin.  

Monica lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more jerycans of local gin

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
34-year-old Ivy G. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has a 2-year-old child. She grows rice and raises pigs and ducks. She and her husband till their farm where they plant and harvest rice crops. They sell their harvest to the market and use some for family consumption. They also use their backyard to grow pigs and ducks. Ivy fattens the pigs and sells the duck eggs.

Ivy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ivy has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Ivy is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to buy farm supplies and feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and feeds

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Solidaridad Cachimayo” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cachimayo district of the province of Chincheros.

His name is Rene and he is 36 years old.  Rene is married and has two children.  He is requesting the loan to invest in his transportation business.  He is part of a cooperative and runs a bus from Cusco, Peru to Anta.  He will invest in both maintenance of the vehicle and gasoline to run the route.

Rene commits to making his payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in bus maintenance

loans.name: Ikusasalathu Group

texts.en:
Jabulisiwe is a 50-year-old widowed mother with three children, ages 27-34. She lives in Hlabisa, South Africa (KZN) and runs a retail business selling chickens and renting African skirts for Zulu traditional dances. She is the leader of her borrowing group, and in the photo above she is wearing an orange shirt.

She's been in this business for two years. She sells chicken and eggs from her home. She has two main challenges to her business: she is dependent on traditional dances occurring, and some customers take chickens on credit and do not pay.

She requested this loan through Women's Development Businesses and KIVA to buy beads, black material, and other materials for traditional skirts. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her send her grandchild to school, pay for her school fees and build a family house. In the future, she would like to see her business grow and add more traditional clothing, like shirts and trousers. She would also like to have a formal place to advertise her business.

She appreciates WDB and Kiva and would like to see WDB and Kiva one day come to her home to see the result of the loan she got from them.

loans.use: To buy beads, black material for skirts, and cotton

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a fifty-nine-year-old married man with seven children. He lives in a semi-permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo in Uganda. He rears cows and his dream is to expand his farm to have at least fifty cows. Peter wants a loan to purchase a heifer.

loans.use: To buy a heifer

loans.name: Redempter

texts.en:
Redempter is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya, where she has been farming for nine years now. Her mixed farm is currently producing milk that is sold to the local market. She is also employed as a casual laborer in a local hospital.

Redempter is 46 years old and married. She has 4 school-aged children who all attend school.

She has requested for a loan of KES 60,000, through Juhudi Kilimo, for poultry farming. The proceeds from this loan will assist in the education of her children in college and high schools. She says that her major challenge has been lack of stable market for milk. She however plans to rear over 500 chickens and acquire 4 quality dairy cows in the next 5 years.

loans.use: Poultry farming.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a widowed woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a real estate [management] business for the past seven years.  Her customers are neighboring community members. Selina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to own her own rental houses in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase blocks and cement to renovate her real estate houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to lift her living standard.

loans.use: To purchase blocks and cement to renovate her real estate houses.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is married with one child who attends school. Her husband is a judiciary officer and he contributes to his family's basic needs. Lucia has operated a business of selling bags and belts from door to door to local residents for the past two years. 

Lucia dreams of establishing a large scale business in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase bags and belts for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of its variety of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase bags and belts for sale.

loans.name: Darin

texts.en:
Darin is a young woman from village of Reineh in northern Israel. She holds a computer engineering degree. While Darin worked in her field she found it extremely difficult to find an adequate and worthy position in Reineh or surrounding area. She decided she did not want to leave her village, home and family to relocate for a position in central Israel. Reineh decided to utilize her degree on the side by giving private training courses and at the same time develop a steady income through opening a business. In 2008 she opened a shoe and gift shop. Over the last two years Darin decided to remodel her store and focus on gifts while expanding into scarves, accessories and religious clothing. These items have year-wide demand as opposed to seasonal.

Darin needed this loan to purchase stock and build new shelving for her store.

Over the next few years Darin wants to continue to expand her business, hire staff and bring in area clients who now purchase in stores outside of the village. She sees her business becoming the store of choice for women from her village and the surrounding area.

loans.use: to purchase stock and build new shelving for her store

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 57 years old and married with six children. 

Lucia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store. 

Lucia has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from food vending. 

Lucia aspires to save enough money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio G. is a married man with nine children. He is 56 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for five years. 

He sells items like soaps, shampoos and dry goods to the people in his community. He earns enough income with his business. 

He is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more items to sell and provide his customers with a wider variety of product selections. 

In the future, Bonifacio hopes to manage a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell and provide his customers a wider variety of product selections.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: El señor Antonio es empleado, trabaja en la empresa ENFE  y su esposa es artesana; ella se dedica a tejer mantas y las comercializa los días jueves y domingos en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de lanas de diversos colores y texturas para que su esposa pueda continuar con el negocio de tejer mantas. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de  Villa Ingenio en la ciudad de El Alto; es casado, tiene cuatro hijos. Es primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Antonio is employed and he works at the ENFE company. His wife is an artisan. She knights blankets and she sells them on Thursdays and Sundays at the 16 de Julio fair in the city of El Alto. He require a loan to purchase wool yarn in various colors and textures for his wife to continue with her business and to make more blankets. He lives in a house which they own and it is located in the region of Villa Ingenio in the city of El Alto. They have four children. This is his first loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner) and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase wool yarn of different colors and texture for his wife to continue with her business knitting blankets.

loans.name: Green Group

texts.en:
Masali, in his early 30's, is married with one son who attends school. He has been running a mobile phone sales business for 5 years, working from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily. Masali is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Masali's 2nd motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to repay their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Masali used the previous loan to increase his phone stock and has repaid it successfully.  He hopes for a loan to buy more mobile phones and phone accessories to sell. His dream is to one day own a big shop where he will have a big stock of phones.

Masali will share this loan with his group "Green", consisting of 7 members, who will hold each other accountable in repaying their loans.

loans.use: To  buy more mobile phones and phone accessories  to sell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Antonio es  trabajador y emprendedor. Él es propietario de una sastrería desde hace 35 años aproximadamente y entrega ropa en mercado de Masaya y en el norte del país (Matagalpa, Estelí, Nueva Segovia, Chontales). 
Francisco trabaja junto a su esposa y sus siete hijos los cuales son mayores de edad. Con el crédito comprará telas, hilos, botones…etc. materia prima para su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisco Antonio is hard working and enterprising.  He has owned a tailor shop for 35 years approximately.  He sells his clothes in the market in Masaya and in the north of the country (Matagalpa, Estelí, Nueva Segovia and Chontales).

Francisco works alongside his wife and seven children who are all adults.  He will use the loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, etc.; the raw materials for his work.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and buttons.

loans.name: Ana Karen

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como la subidita al cielo en el barrio San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúnen las socias  del Banco Comunal Subidita Al Cielo, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 22 años  de edad, es madre soltera de dos  niñas de 6 y 5 años de edad, ambas  estudian en escuela. Ella vive en una casa de sus padres que le han dado para que viva. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque la institución le apoya mucho.

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que para que a sus pequeñas no les falte nada se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogos, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta ya que tres días a la a semana ella se va a ofrecer sus productos a sus vecinos y conocidos,  nos cuenta que  realiza los pedidos de sus clientes y que les da muchas facilidades de pago. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana ya que tres días entrega y los domingos se dedica a cobrar y también a realizar ventas. Recién lleva 4 meses en esta actividad, antes tenía una tienda de abarrotes pero tuvo que cerrarla por falta de tiempo para atenderla pero ahora con la venta de ropa nos cuenta que le va mejor.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es de sus padres.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Subidita al Cielo” meet every 15 days in an area with the same name in the city of Portoviejo. This marginal urban area is the most populated section of the city.

It is here that one can meet Sra. Ana. She is 22 years old and a single mother with two daughters, ages 6 and 5. Both of them attend school. She lives at home with her parents, who have given her everything she needs to live. Ana has participated in four loan cycles with the Communal Bank and enjoys being a member because of the tremendous support she has received.

She is a determined woman. In order to provide everything her children need, Ana sells clothing thorough catalogs. She goes door-to-door three days per week to make her sales. Ana offers her products to neighbors and acquaintances. She says that she is able to generate orders and offer her customers several payment options. Ana works a total of four days each week, three days are designated for making deliveries and then she collects payment on Sundays. During this time, she is also making sales. Ana recently started selling clothes four months ago. She previously operated a grocery store, but she had to close it because she did not have enough time to manage the business. Now that she sells clothes, Ana says she is doing better.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise such as trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and children’s clothing. Her dream is to own a house since she currently lives with her parents.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Marinette

texts.fr:
Cliente de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 10 et 16 ans, en 1998,  quand elle a eu son premier enfant, elle se lance dans la petite pâtisserie pour pouvoir venir en aide a son mari et a sa famille. Elle commence la fabrication de ses beignets de bon matin,ses potentiels clients sont la majorité des élèves et collégiens  qui  vont de bon matin a l'école primaire situe non loin de sa maison.
Elle vend en moyenne 8000 a 15.000 fr par jour.

A l'octroi se ce prêt , elle va acheter 50kg d farine, 50 kg de sucre, 5kg de margarine, 25kg de lait en poudre, 50kg de riz pour préparer la bouillie du riz au lait.

Ayant deja une grande maitrise dans l'exercice de son activité, elle épargne pour qu'a la longue, elle aide son mari a construire une maison pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
This customer is 39 years old, married and a mother of four children aged 10 to 16. In 1998, after having her first child, she launched her small pastry business to be able to help her husband and family. She starts preparing her fritters early in the morning, her potential customers mostly being the elementary and middle school students who go to the primary school located near her house. Her daily sales are generally between 8,000 and 15,000 XAF.
With this loan, she will purchase 50 kilos of flour, 50 kilos of sugar, 5 kilos of margarine, 25 kilos of powdered milk and 50 kilos of rice to prepare rice porridge with milk.
She is already quite experienced in running her business and is saving for the long-term, to help her husband build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy 50-kilo bags of flour and sugar, 25 kilos of milk, a 5-kilo jar of margarine and baking powder.

loans.name: Munkhjargal

texts.en:
Munkhjargal, 41, is a home television repairman.  He lives with his wife and 4 children in his own house in Erdenet, the third-largest city in Mongolia. His older daughter, 21, works for a private company. The others are pupils in secondary school. 

Munkhjargal started his own business in 2000 and he plans to expand and improve it in the future. Currently, he and his family are renovating their home to improve their living conditions. But now he can’t finish the renovation, due to a finance issue. Therefore, Munkhjargal is taking a loan to buy some construction materials to finish the adjustment to his house and improve the family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy some construction materials to finish a home renovation

loans.name: Luz Daris

texts.es: Luz Daris  vive en el municipio de Arjona, municipio del departamento de Bolivar, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos, motor de todos sus esfuerzos, que se encuentran  en las edades de 4 a 17 años.  Su negocio inició en su propia casa hace 6 años vendiendo comida a domicilio y especiales a través de la preparación de “buffets”,  para fiestas, repostería y como su negocio fue creciendo se trasladó a un local comercial, ubicado en la plaza principal de la población,  donde a través de una mejor exhibición y preparación de sus productos, ha logrado el reconocimiento razón  por la cual sus ventas se han incrementado y los productos  se terminan muy pronto. Su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para lograr hacer compras en mayor volumen y obtener descuentos que aumentarían sus utilidades. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que  hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará materias primas para la elaboración de sus productos además de jugos, bebidas frías licores y mecatos.  Su sueño es tener un negocio más en la vía principal  del pueblo instalando una especie de bohío que impacte la atención de sus clientes. Mientras da rienda suelta a su sueño y trabaja para lograrlo, maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas, no menores del 27% y una rentabilidad sobre la inversión del 20,28%.
texts.en: Luz Daris lives in the municipality of Arjona. It is a municipality in the department of Bolivar. She is married and she has 3 children. They are the force behind her efforts and they are 4 and 17 years old. She started out her business six years ago from her own home, selling prepared foods in her home, catering parties in a buffet style, and baking pastries. And as her business increased she moved it to a commercial store space. It is located in the main town square where she has earned a wider recognition through better exhibition and preparation of her products. Her sales have increased and her products sell out quickly. Her working capital is not sufficient to make purchases in larger volumes and to obtain the discounts that would increase her yield. This is the reason why she requests a Kiva loan. It is the first loan she accesses through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With her loan she will purchase ingredients needed to make her products and to purchase juices, cold drinks, liquors, and spirits. Her dream is to have a business in a more central location in her town and installing a type of palm hut to attract the attention of her clients. While sets herself loose to pursue her dream and as she works to attain it, she observes a sales profit of no less than 27% and a profit margin of 20.28% on her investments.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to make her products and to purchase juices, cold drinks, liquors, and spirits.

loans.name: Okiljon

texts.ru:
Окилчон целеустремленный и добросовестный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 4 детей. Его жена работает врачом в роддоме. Окилчон занимается купля продажей сухофруктов и более 8 лет он продолжает расширить этот бизнес. Он покупает сухофруктов оптом, а затем реализует их на местных рынков. Его жена помогает ему для сортировки сухофруктов. Он хочет расширит свой бизнес и увеличить свой оборотный капитал для этого ему необходимо дополнительные ресурсы, из-за этого он запрашивает займ в размере 1000$ США. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Okiljon is a motivated and conscientious man. He is married and the loving father of 4 children. His wife is a doctor in a maternity clinic. Okiljon buys and sells dried fruits and has continued to expand this business for more than 8 years. He purchases dried fruits in bulk and then sells them at local markets. His wife helps him sort the fruit. He wants to expand his business and increase his working capital. To do this he needs additional resources and is requesting a loan of $1000 US.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Mashauri Group

texts.fr: La cliente Zainabo, leader du groupe d’affaire «Mashauri», est jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 37  ans, mère de 10 enfants  qui étudient tous. Elle est  vendeuse d’habits (friperies).  Son mari est un petit commerçant de divers. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché central Virunga. Il y a 9 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  11 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  3 ballons de friperies à marchander.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et agrandir son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
This client named Zainabo, leader of the business group called «Mashauri», is a young entrepreneur of 37, the mother of 10 children who all go to school. She sells used clothing. Her husband is a small-scale retailer. She displays her merchandise at the central market of  Virunga. She has been earning money through small businesses of this type for nine years, but she has completed eleven loan cycles with Hekima. 

This new loan will serve to buy three bales of used clothes for resale. Beyond that, she hopes to see her children grow up comfortably and to expand her business. This client thanks Hekima for its work to help poor women who are excluded from traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy three bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Wilma has been in this business for 10 years. Wilma earns additional income from a general store.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia Anselma tiene 52 años de edad; la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 26, 24, 20, 16 años de edad; la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia vende productos secos como maíz, habas, y otras menestras como porotos, lentejas, pallares; la socia trabaja arduamente para seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios y la alimentación diaria, ella en esta oportunidad desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de productos secos al por mayor para implementar su negocio ubicado  en uno de los mercados en la ciudad. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos secos.


La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y asi mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “TRES DE MAYO”. The bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco.

The member Anselma is 52 years old. She is married and has 4 children of 26, 24, 20 and 16 years of age. The member works in the retail business, selling dry goods such as corn, broad beans and other vegetables such as green beans, lentils and lima beans. The member works hard to continue supporting her children with their education and their daily food. This time she wants to invest in purchasing dry goods wholesale. 

The member is grateful for the support given her and as such agrees to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy dry goods.

loans.name: Malou

texts.en:
Malou believes that through patience and hard work, she will become successful in life. She is now 33, married and has five school-age children. Malou and her husband aim to earn and save more income to acquire their basic needs and support the schooling of their children. They want them to earn a degree and become professionals someday. Despite the hardships in life, they are striving hard to support their family.

To generate income, Malou is engaged in buying and selling of handicrafts in their community while her husband manages their farm. She wants to acquire more handicrafts to sell, but her capital is not sufficient. Therefore, she wants to ask for additional capital of 20,000 PHP to buy chairs, baskets, soft brooms and more furniture to sell. She is hoping that this loan will help a lot to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy chairs, baskets, soft brooms and more furniture to sell

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
Argie is 28 years old. She is married with three children.

Argie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Argie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future,  Argie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy additional snacks and basic goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.ru: Хамза житель района Джиликул. Ему 40 лет. Он занимается растениеводством. Он в основном сеет пшеницу и выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 24 года. Кредит берет для закупа селитры и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Hamza is a resident of the Jilikul district.  He is 40 years.  Hamza is involved in agriculture and primarily sows wheat and grows vegetables.  He has been in this business for 24 years.  Hamza is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Shelamie

texts.en:
Shelamie is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Shelamie is making and peddling viands like "ginataang langka" (unripe jackfruit cooked in coconut milk), "atsara" (pickled unripe papaya),  & "mongo" (mung bean) soup. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

Shelamie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Shelamie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

loans.name: Bora

texts.en:
Bora (in the photo) and his wife, Saroth, have been married since 1986 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. One sells fish, three are in school and another one stays at home. The family lives in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Bora and his wife sell fish and chicken. They buy fish and chicken from the Prek Pnao market and transport them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. 

Bora is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for his daughter who sells fish. She will use the motorbike to carry fish for sale because she is currently using a bicycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his daughter to carry fish for sale.

loans.name: Haydie

texts.en: Haydie is 35 years old and is married with 7 children. The oldest child is 19 years old. Haydie and her husband have been running a fishing business for 19 years. This business provides for their needs and helps send their children to school. Haydie  requested this loan to purchase a boat engine and nylon. She does her best to take care of her family and improve their income. Haydie hopes to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine and nylon.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.en: For the past 10 years Benedicto, a 50-year married father of three who lives in the Philippines, has operated a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. A member of HSPFI since 2011, he is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, Benedicto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Hourn

texts.en:
Hourn is a 48-year-old, married woman who resides in Kampong Chnang province.

To earn a living, Hourn raises pigs. Her husband pumps sand to generate income.

Hourn is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase cows to raise and then sale. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, Hourn would like to use any additional income from her business to run a small farm on her plot of farmland. This would be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase cows to raise and then sell for a profit

loans.name: You

texts.en:
You is 43 years old and is married and with six single children, some of whom are attending school. She is from the Ang Snoul district and has been a rice farmer for more than 12 years. You is able to generate 3 USD per day. The main source of the household's income is her husband, who works as a policeman at the Ministry of Interior at Phnom Penh city. 

You is requesting a loan to buy a used motorcycle for her son to provide a motor-taxi service which will give the family increased income. You hopes that she will be able to provide her school-aged children with consistent support until they finish junior high school.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her son

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 21 years old, he is single and lives in Majengo Village, Patrick he has been a volunteer for more than 6 years. He has lead many health outreach programmes targeting the youth both in schools and in the community. Patrick  also participates in activities supporting men to stop domestic violence.. Patrick also participates in  women groups activities advising on safe water usage and general hygiene. Patrick aspires to be a nurse in near future.

The greatest challenge in performing his duties as a Community Health Worker has been low incentives and transportation, as he has to cover many household spread between far locations, the terrain can also be difficult especially during the rainy season. Having a motorcycle will enhance is work, increase the coverage and thus the number of household visited in a given period. The motorcycle will be a working tool to enhance easy and faster access to health services to the community. While not being used for community outreach activities the motorcycle will be engaged in micro-business errands such as community taxi, community courier service, milk delivery service etc bringing the needed extra incomes to the families. This is a big incentive to the CHWs who are mostly young at the beginning of their careers in the Health sector. 

Motorcycle micro business in Kenya is a thriving sector with very good returns, the motorcycle costs about USD1300,however,riders are bale to make net returns of about USD15 per day, while the loan repayment is about USD4 per day, payable in 18 months. BodAfya is a new loan product which has proved very popular with CHWs. The product is well linked with the existing CHWs public systems and networks in Kenya. It has positive benefits of supporting the community health programmes, and at the same time supporting families improve their livelihoods and incomes, resulting to a healthier and wealthier community.

loans.use: To buy a Motorcycle for Community Health Work

loans.name: Alas De Cofradia Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores de éxito una de ella es Esther tiene 21 años de edad, casada y se dedica a vender cosméticos y ropas variada desde hace 5 años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos de la Avon como cremas para cuerpos, crema para manos, crema facial, perfumen de dama, perfume de varón etc. 

Los otro dos del grupo: Dora tiene 32 años de edad y vende ropa nueva y variada y Félix vende leche de vaca ambulante con carretón de caballos.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three successful entrepreneurs. Esther is one of them: she is 21 years old, she is married and she has been engaging in selling cosmetics and different kinds of clothes for 5 years already. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy Avon cosmetics such as body lotions, hand lotions, face lotions, women's perfumes, men's perfumes and other products. 


The other two members of the group:  Dora is 32 years old and she sells different kinds of new clothes, and Félix is a street vendor selling cow milk that he transports with a horse-driven cart.

loans.use: To buy body lotions, hand lotions, face lotions, women's perfumes, men's perfumes among other products.

loans.name: Marie Michelle

texts.fr: Marie Michelle, 35 ans, commerçante, vit avec son mari et sa fille. Elle a démarré ses activités en vendant des vêtements d’occasion importés. Après quelques démarches auprès d’un bureau de Palmis de son quartier, elle obtient un microcrédit qui lui a permis d’augmenter son stock.

loans.use: augmenter son stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her printing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary Wanjiku intends to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Chek

texts.en:
Mrs. Chek M., 39 years mother of 3 children, lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She sells fish on the roadside of a village and typically makes about $10/day in revenue, while her husband is talent in fishery and normally catches many fishes a day for her to sell.
Chek M. hopes the loan will assist her to purchase a boat with machine, fishing net, fishing rod, and other materials for her husband to run his fishery. 
In the future, she would like to save enough money to own a stand in a market as well as building a new house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a boat with machine, fishing net, fishing rod and other meterials for her husband's fishery.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
My name is Victoria Carrazan. I have had a store for 4 years from which I provide for myself and my family. I have good clientele, some of whom include neighbors from the community. I now need to make additional purchases in order to be able to provide better services now that I have a higher demand for various products. My goal is to make my store larger in order to be able to have a better income and better sales.

Translated from to English by Kiva Volunteer, Rebecca Pendleton

Mi nombre es Victoria Carrazan, yo tengo una pulperia hace 4 años. el cual es mi sustento de vida para familia. Tengo buenos clientes los cules son tambien mis vecinos de toda la comunidad. ahora necesito hacer varias compra para poder dar un mejor servicio ya que tengo mucha demanda de varios productos, Tengo de meta hacer mas grande mi pulperia para poder tener mejores ingresos y tener mejores ventas.

loans.use: To buy bread, milk, juice, beans, sugar, soap, noodles etc.

loans.name: Patricia Alejandra

texts.es:
Patricia is married and has two children. Her husband is a TV and radio repair man, and cannot earn enough money to fully support his family. After seeing the situation that he was in she started to buy paper products to sell and help out her family financially. In addition to playing the lottery (a typical game in Mexico) she began buying notebooks, sheets of paper, pencils, pens, and things like this. Little by little, she kept acquiring more things to get herself ahead.

Patricia is asking for a loan of $475, and hopes to pay it back in a period of 3 months. The loan is to be used to buy more paper products, and make her business bigger and therefore her sales too. Already, the people are asking for her products to buy. Having a larger assortment will assist her in helping to maintain her family. Thanks to all for your help so that I will be able to do better in my business.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricia es casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo se dedica a la reparación de televisores y radios y no le alcanza su dinero para mantener a su familia, por ver la situación en la que estaba empezó a comprar papelería para vender y ayudar económicamente a su familia además de hacer lotería (juego típico en México), comenzó comprando libretas, hojas, lápiz, plumas y así poco a poco cada vez fui haciéndose de mas cosas, para poder salir adelante.

Patricia pide un préstamo de USD $ 475, esperando pagar el este en un plazo de 3 meses para poder comprar más papelería y poder hacer mas grande su negocio y por ende sus ventas, ya que la buscan mucho sus vecinas para comprar y tener mayor surtido y así poder ayudar en la manutención de su familia, agradece todo el apoyo brindado para mejorar en su negocio.

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Nasimhon

texts.ru:
Nasimhon M. is 49 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 4 children. He plans to use the loan to purchase two pieces of livestock, which he plans to feed and sell. He has been raising livestock for 15 years. Because it is currently hard to find steady employment, this business lets Nasimhon provide for his needs. He plans to use revenues from the sale of the livestock to purchase new livestock and feed and after 40-45 days to start the process again.

Nasimhon plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Менгалиев Насимхон, возраст – 49 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 4-х детей. На полученный кредит клиент хочет приобрести 2 головы крупного рогатого скота, который планирует откормить и продать. Разведением домашнего скота Насимхон занимается уже в течение 15 лет. Так как в настоящий момент очень трудно найти постояное место работы, для Насимхона такой вид деятельности является источником приносящий прибыль, позволяющий ему удовлетворять свои человеческие потребности. На вырученные деньги от продажи скота он планирует покупать молодняк и корм для его откормки и после 40-45 дней продавать его. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock for resale

loans.name: Ahliddin

texts.ru:
Ahliddin Z. is 27 years old, has a college education and is an economist by training. He is married and has 2 children. Ahliddin owns a car which he uses to offer taxi services to residents of Qurgan-Tube. Ahliddin will use his loan to purchase equipment that will allow him to use gas instead of gasoline in his car. This will allow him to control his costs and to not raise his fares. Local residents will be able to take advantage of Ahliddin’s lower priced fares, as many cannot afford the fare increases resulting from increasing gasoline prices. Ahliddin will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Зайниддинов Ахлиддин, возраст – 27 лет, образование высшее, по специальности – экономист, женат, имеет 2 детей. Ахлиддин имеет собственную машину, на которой оказывает услуги такси населению города Курган-Тюбе. Так как в настоящее время цены на бензин ежедневно растут, что увеличивает плату за услуги такси и не каждый житель может себе этого позволить. Ахлиддин на полученный кредит планирует купить и установить на свой автомобиль газовое оборудование. Это даст ему возможность не повышать цену за проезд, так как цены на газ растут не так быстро, как на бензин. Жители смогут пользоваться его услугами по цене ниже других таксистов, использующих в качестве топлива бензин. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase car equipment

loans.name: Isidora

texts.en:
Isidora S. G. sells watches in the jungle city of Tarapoto, San Martin. She sets up a stand every morning across the street from the major market in the center of Tarapoto. She’s been selling watches and accessories for 8 years and now has many loyal customers.

Isidora is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children. She enjoys working and helping her family. Without the money she has earned selling watches, her children would have never had the opportunity to study. Isidora is proud of her accomplishments and has gained a lot of confidence. Her business brought her independence, a voice, and self-esteem.

A member of the community bank Nuestra Sra De La Paz, Isidora is requesting a loan of $700 (s/2000) to repay over 6 months. With the extra capital, she would like to buy watches, batteries, and spare parts.

loans.use: She would like to buy watches, batteries, and spare parts

loans.name: Haadija's Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Hadija is 38 years old and is a married woman with one child, age 21. Hadija owns a small grocery, which she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 9:30 AM to 5 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $240 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have food vending and salon businesses.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Mrs. C. has worked with our institution since 2007. She sells plastic products, and also earns money from selling corn-derived products out of her home, like toasted corn flour and a traditional corn and cocoa-based drink. The loans she has been given have been used as capital for her work.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

La señora C. trabaja con nuestra institución desde el año 2007 ella se dedica a la venta de productos plasticos y ademas cuenta con otros ingresos por venta de productos derivados del maiz los que vende en su casa, tales como tiste, pinol y otros. los prestamos que se le han otorgado ha sidi destinados a capital de trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase plastic products (e.g. bags)

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
My name is Eugenia C. and I live in San Pedro Sacatepequez. I´m 50 years old. I make blouses embroidered by hand, with the typical huípil design. When I was ten years old I learned how to weave and and also swe with a machine. I worked several years for a clothing factory--I would make the shirts in my house for the company. But then the factory hired a lot of people and so I decided to start my own business. I continued to weave, making belts, huípil blouses and embroidering blouses to earn money for my family alongside my husband. When my daughters started growing up they helped me.

I need more capital to invest in the material to make the embroidery and fabrics. When I buy in greater quantities it´s cheaper. I have people working for me to satisfy my clients´ orders. One plan I have is to buy a large number of embroidered napkin sets from people I know. I need sufficient capital to invest in this.

I feel happy since I´m giving work to my family and together we´ll get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

Vivo en San Pedro Sacatepequez, mi nombre es Eugenia C., tengo 50 años de edad. Actualmente me dedico a la elaboración de blusas bordadas a mano, tejidos de güipiles típicos. Cuando tenía 10 años de edad aprendí a tejer y también a coser a máquina, trabaje varios años para una fabrica de ropa, yo trabajaba en mi casa y en la fabrica me daban trabajo para que elaborara camisas en mi casa, pero con el tiempo las fabricas empezaron a contratar mucha gente para que les trabajara, entonces era tiempo que me dedicara a mi propio negocio, así que seguí tejiendo, haciendo fajas, güipiles y bordando blusas, para ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos de la casa, conforme fueron crecido mis hijas, ellas también empezaron a ayudarme. Necesito más capital para invertir en la compra de material para elaborar los bordados y tejidos ya que al comprar cantidades mas grandes me sale mas barato, y es que tengo a varias personas que trabajan para mi, para poder sacar los pedidos que mis clientes me hacen, entre mis planes es que la cantidad de servilletas típicas, ya las personas que se dedican a elaborar servilletas vienen a entregarme su producto, pero como son por docenas que ellos me dejan yo necesito tener suficiente capital para poder comprarlos, me siento muy contenta ya que les doy trabajo a mi familia y juntos estamos saliendo adelante.

loans.use: Buy material for embroidery and invest in cloth napkin sets

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mr. Sophea H., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Kimsroeun Thun, 32, who live on an Island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1997 and have four children, one son and three daughters. Three of their children are in school and one is still young, so stays at home.

Mr. Sophea has been a carpenter for seventeen years, a skill he learned from his brother. He does his work in the village and in Phnom Penh. Mrs. Kimsroeun has been a silk weaver since 1997. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Currently, Sophea is in the process of building one kitchen room and one rest room (shown in the picture).

Now Sophea is requesting a loan of US$900 to purchase silk materials for weaving and building one kitchen room and one rest room to use in the family.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and build one kitchen room and one rest room.

loans.name: Gadir

texts.en: Gadir was born in 1959. He is married and has 3 children. He lives in Khachmaz town. This man has been selling agricultural produce in the market for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of $750 to buy produce.

loans.use: Buy the agricultural produce

loans.name: Asra

texts.en:
Asra is single. She owns a small shop that she has been running since 2005. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 10 PM at her business where she can earn a monthly profit of about $100 from her sales.

In the past, Asra has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 38 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She lives in a small village in the West Bekaa where she owns a grocery shop. Amina is a very responsible mother whose priority in life is the improvement of her business, which is the only source of income for her family.

With the beginning of the "back to school" season, there is an increased demand for stationery products. Amina needs a loan of $US1,200 to purchase more goods to attract more clients and thereby expand her business. This is the first time that Amina has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a fisherman. Margaret has received no formal education. She is responsible for feeding her family and paying the utility bills.

Margaret buys fish from fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and sells them at the market at Mpoben near Elmina. She also sells soft drinks as an additional job to earn more income. She has been selling fish and soft drinks since 2005.

Margaret will use this loan to buy more fish and soft drinks to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband start putting up a house for the family.

loans.use: To buy more fish and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es: La señora Marilu pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Perseverantes”, ubicado en el Jr. 1 de Mayo Nº 678 “Micaela Bastidas”, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años de edad y es soltera. Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de vinos. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.nnEn la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio de “venta de vinos de uvas”, el cual le  brinda ganancias que le permite pagar su préstamo puntualmente.nnCon este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 4 galones de vinos de uvas para vender a sus clientes.nnMarilu agradece a Manuela Ramos por la ayuda brindada, lo cual le permitirá seguir ampliando más su negocio.nn
texts.en:
Mrs. Marilu is a member of the "Mujeres Perseverantes" Communal Bank, located at 678 "Micaela Bastidas", Jr. 1 de Mayo, in the Calleria district, Coronel Portillo Province, in the region of Ucayali. She is 39 years old and single. She has been working with the Communal Bank for 2 years. The first loan she received from Manuela Ramos was of $100, which she invested into the sale of wines. Today, she continues her business selling grape wines, which earns her enough income for the punctual payment of her loans. With this next loan of $325, which will be payed back over 4 months, she will buy 4 gallons of wine to sell to her clients. Marilu is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the assistance they offer, which allows her to continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of 4 gallons of grape wine

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "SOL NACIENTE" REPRESENTADAS POR LA SEÑORA R. GERTRUDIS CURSAN SU SEGUNDO CICLO CUMPLIENDO CON LA FUNDACION EN FORMA RESPONSABLE Y CUMPLIDA.  EN GENERAL LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SE DEDICAN  A LA VENTA D. COMIDA, ROPA, CRISTALES, PLASTICO, VERDUAR, A LA ELAVORACION Y CONFECCION D. RENDAS D. VESTIR Y ZAPATOS ASI COMO AL SERVICIO MECANICO Y AL SEVICIO PUBLICO. EL  DESTINO D. CRÉDITO D. ESTE GRUPO ES PARA INCREMENTAR MERCADERIA D. SUS NEGOCIOS Y A LA COMPRA D. HERRAMIENTAS PARA MEJOR LA CALIDAD D. SUS PRODUCTOS. lOS SOCIOS TIENEN EXPERENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDADRIOS POR LO QUE CONOCEN D. LA RESPONSABILIDAD QUE SE NECESITA PARA LA ADQUICICION D. ESTE FINANCIAMIENTO.
texts.en:
The “Sol Naciente” (Rising Sun) group, represented by Ms. R. Gertrudis, is in its second loan cycle, having responsibly fulfilled its obligations with the foundation. In general, the members of the group sell food, clothing, crystal, plastic and vegetables. Other members make clothing and footwear, while still others proviD. auto mechanic services and other public services. This group loan will be used to increase merchandise for the members’ businesses. They will also purchase tools to improve the quality of their products. The members have experience with solidarity groups, so they understand the responsibility needed to obtain this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Rani Sharif Group

texts.en:
Rani baji is a 43 year old lady who resides in a famous historical place called Yadgar in Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house in this place, where she has been living with her family for the past 3 years. Rani baji is a widow. Her husband died of a heart attack. His sudden death made her mentally unstable, but she recovered when she saw that her children were sad and depressed. She toughened herself for the sake of her children. She started sewing clothes by taking orders from her neighbors. One of her neighbors helped her out by giving her a contact at a garment factory. The factory owner gave her number of clothes to stitch. She completed the order and earned an income.

With this income, she started a business of making steel wire. She handed over this business to her sons. Now they are independently handling this business and earning income. Her first two daughters work in a cold drink factory and her younger daughter reads in 4th standard. Rani baji successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy some more tools to expand her sons' steel wire business. 

She is a group leader of a few more members of her locality. Suraiya baji and Nasreen baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shop. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy iron to resell. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy tools for making steel wire

loans.name: Pao's Group

texts.en:
The group of borrowers consists of three people. Its leader, Pao Y., is 59 years old. She earns a living selling traditional khmer cakes. She normally sells the ingredients from the market, like rice, pork, sugar, etc, mixing and boiling them and selling her cakes to villagers. She is married with three children; two of them are married and the other one is single. Two of her children are employed as garment workers, while her husband is a local carpenter. To reduce the cost of transportation for the family, Y. has applied for a loan to purchase a used motorcycle for her family's transportation needs. There are another two borrowers below:
M., 44, is a local tailor and she needs a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband to ride to work.
M., age 50, sells khmer cakes. She is applying for a loan to buy a cow-cart. The borrowers live in Choam Chao Commune in Phnom Penh City of Cambodia.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 55 years old and married with 6 children. She sells sarongs. She loves this business because she makes a lot of profit from this business. She hopes for a loan to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeun A., 55, and her husband, Mr. Sam-at Preab, 62, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1980 and have three children: one son, who is a mason, and two daughters. One of their daughters is married, but lives inside the family home, and another one is a silk weaver.

Soeun has been a silk weaver for 28 years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a house constructor for 28 years as well.

Soeun is requesting her first loan of $800 to purchase silk material for her weaving business and to set up one more loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk material and to set up one more loom

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana A., age forty–five, is a married mother of five children, two of whom are females and three males. According to her, one of her children is in the tertiary level of polytechnic, while the rest are in the senior high, junior high, and basic schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband works at the local government hospital.

Christiana works very hard to help her husband provide for the family financially. She sells provisions on a tabletop by the roadside in her community. She also runs a cold store. She procures her products from Kumasi. Christiana has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure more goods. She hopes to sponsor all her children to the tertiary level of education.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr:
A. Christine à 54 ans. Christine est veuve et mère de trois (03) enfants tous scolarisés. Christine réside avec ses enfants à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Christine vend de poisons séchés, de sel de cuisine, de tamarin, de légumes, etc. C'est au marché de Gbégamey que Christine vend ses produits. Grâce à cette activité Christine arrive à satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants. 
Pour mieux répondre à la demande sa clientèle qui devient de plus en plus importante et élever le niveau de son activité, Christine sollicite un prêt de ALIDé. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Christine A. is 54 years old. She is a widow and the mother of three children, all of whom attend school. Christine lives with her children in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.
