Christine sells dried fish, cooking salt, tamarind, vegetables, etc. Christine sells her products in Gbégamey market. Thanks to this business, Christine is able to provide for herself and her children. To better meet the demand of her ever-growing clientele and to increase her business profits, Christine has requested a loan from Alidé. In Benin’s local language of Fon, Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest”. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria which has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of baskets of fish, bags of salt and vegetables.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods and drinks. She has applied for a loan to buy a generator and more drinks to sell. The generator will allow her to sell cold drinks even during power outages. Gladys is 49 years old, married and has three children. She wishes to express her thanks to all Kiva lenders for their generosity and support.

loans.use: To buy a generator and additional drinks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Palima

texts.en:
Palima S. sells locally brewed alcohol and requests a loan to open up a bar as a sales outlet. She is married to a driver, is 38 years old, and has five children who are not attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she will build a house and rent it out.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bar as a sales outlet

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa B., 40 years old, is married. Of her six children, one passed away some years ago. Two are in school and three are working on their own.

Adwoa is a trader. She trades in rice and other cereals. She has been trading for the past three years, and since beginning this business she been very resourceful in supporting her family. She buys her rice and other cereals in bags and sells in measuring cups to her customers. She sells by hawking her products from house to house. She journeys to the farming area of Koforidua in the eastern region of Ghana to buy her foodstuffs.

She wants to use this loan to buy a larger supply of rice to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. This she believes will enable her to save more to support her children in school.

Adwoa belongs to a village bank called "Nyame Adom," which means "God’s Grace."

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of rice and other cereals for sale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
To have a piggery business that will support all their needs is Lydia P.'s long term goal. She turns 60 years old this year and has two children. She owns a 1-hectare farm and grows rice for many years already. She said that it is difficult if you have a business but no capital to finance its operations.

Thinking of other way to grow her farm, she apply for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, a KIVA partner in the Philippines. She said that the loan will be used to buy 10 liters of crude oil, 2 sacks of fertilizers and to pay the laborer in the farm.

She was blessed with many opportunities. And she would want maximize everything to make her small business grow. CEVI gives her not just loans. It also gives trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 10 liters of crude oil, 2 sacks of fertilizers and to pay the laborer in the farm.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
la sra LUCY A. SANABRIA se dedica al comercio y tiene un negocio de varieddes, mismo que opera bajo el nombre de "VARIEDADES LUCYS"
Su negocio esta ubicado en la terminal de transporte de la ciudad de Danli, frente a la estación de buses de Jacaleapa, ella cuanta con 22 años de experiencia en el negocio.
Doña Lucy, tiene (9) nueve años de haber instalado su propio negocio, mismo que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar muy bien; ella vende su producto al por mayor y menor y tiene vendedores ambulantes dentro de la terminal de transporte dandoles los productos a un costo mas bajo que el que ella vende y teniendo las ganacias a como ellos logren vender a los consumidores, ella es casada con los ingresos que le genera su negocio colabora con su esposo en un 50% a cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
su esposo es comerciante individual, viaja a Panama a comprar mercadería y la distribuye en diferentes departamentos de este país.
texts.en:
Lucy A. Sanabria has a variety store, which she runs under the name "Variedades Lucys" (Lucy's Varieties"). Her business is located in the transportation terminal in the city of Danli, across from the Jacaleapa bus station. She has 22 years of experience in business.

Lucy started her own business nine years ago, and during that time she has learned to manage it very well; she sells her products wholesale and retail, and has peddlers inside the transportation terminal who she sells products to at a lower cost than in her store, and she profits like they do when they sell to customers.

Lucy is married, and with the income from her business, she collaborates with her husband and covers half of the expenses in her household. Her husband is an independent trader who travels to Panama to buy merchandise and distributes it to different regions of Honduras.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy watches, ibuprofen, tetracycline, amoxicillin, acetaminophen, ointment, snail cream, menthol, and gold plating

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase furniture materials

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba is a sixty year old widow with six children, five sons and a daughter, all out of school. As a single parent, she says she works very hard to be able to provide for the family. Abiba lives with some of her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana.

Abiba sells cereals such as maize, beans, etc at the local market and also supplies to food vendors and other retailers in her community. She buys her goods all the way from Northern Ghana and has been in business for over fifteen years. She would like a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Carmen es soltera, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Carmen tiene cabinas de Internet en la selva ayacuchana, en casa de su mama, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su sobrino, además Carmen vende medicina naturales.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la remodelación del Internet.
Los sueños de Carmen son construir su casa y establecer su negocio en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank Love and Truth.

She is single, 27 years old and has one son. Carmen has an internet cafe in the Ayacuchana jungle in her mothers’ house, which she runs with the help of her nephew. Moreover, she sells natural medicine.

Carmen needs a loan of 3000 soles (US $1,025), money that will be invested in the remodeling of the internet cafe. Carmen dreams of building her house and set up her business in the city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel an internet cafe.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em M., 38, is married and lives with two of her children in the Takeo province. She and her husband (pictured) are farmers who typically make about US$2 each day and are. Besides farming, her husband also works as a middle man selling cows. This allows him to earn about US$5 a week. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Em M. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$800 to purchase fertilizer and raise cows. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: buy cows

loans.name: Mariza

texts.en:
Mariza used to provide her sewing services at a street market back in her native Brazil. When she came to the U.S. nine years ago, she worked as a household cleaner, and one day her boss was trying to sew up some torn drapes. When Mariza's boss saw that her sewing quality was of a professional quality, she recommended that she go into business for herself and sew for a living.

In the beginning, Mariza found it difficult to purchase the equipment she needed to start her business because she did not have very much capital. She used her first ACCION USA loan to buy a second sewing machine, and she plans to use this one to buy more materials so she can prepare for an uptick in business with the coming holiday season. She is grateful to have found out about ACCION USA in her local newspaper, because she is able to work with a loan consultant who speaks her language (Portuguese) and who also has the patience to give her detailed advice about her business.

Mariza runs her business out of her home for now, but she plans to one day open her own tailoring shop. She loves what she does because her customers are always impressed with the work and show their gratitude when she finishes a job for them - she says she gets a lot of compliments on her work!

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, and other materials

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Mrs. Ya S. is a 43-year-old married woman living in Sophy village in Takeo province. She has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the other children attend the local school. Her husband, Mr. Mao Thy, is shown on the left of the photo.

She uses rice to make wine to sell to her customers. She is also a pig breeder. Since her business has been doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing four more piglets and pig feed for breeding purposes. She hopes to increase her income and thereby improve her family's standard of living with this loan. Her husband is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. Aside from this work, he is a also construction worker.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing four additional piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Gloria T. le está haciendo falta las protecciones en las ventanas y puerta.
Pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder pagarle a la persona que se encargara de elaborar las protecciones. Es por es por eso que solicita el préstamo y así su casa y familia estarán mas seguras cuando ella y su esposo se encuentre en su trabajo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con su ingreso de su trabajo como policía en la ciudad, ya que su esposo se encargara de los gastos familiares con su ingreso que obtiene como también de policía en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo.
La persona que aparece en la foto es el señor Humberto Hernández esposo de la señora Gloria T., ya que cuando fuimos a la visita  la Doña Gloria estaba en horas del trabajo.
texts.en:
The home of Mrs. Gloria T. is missing the security bars for the windows and the door. But at this time she doesn’t have the money to pay the person who makes them. That is why she is asking for a loan and then her home will be safer when she and her husband are at work. She plans to pay the loan with her husband’s salary since her husband pays the household expenses from his salary as a policeman in Nuevo Laredo. The person shown in the photo is Mr. Humberto Hernandez, Gloria T.’ husband because Gloria was at work when we went to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and install security bars on the windows and doors

loans.name: Primov

texts.ru: Примов Ашур проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 48 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Ашур по специальности "бухгалтер". Он более 30 лет занимается сельским хозяйством, в основном выращивает овощи. Кредит просит для покупки семян, чтобы посеить новый урожай.
texts.en:
A. Primov lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 48 years old. He is married and has three children. A.'s profession is accounting. He has been in agriculture for more than 30 years and mainly grows vegetables. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds to sow a new harvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sow a new harvest

loans.name: Alford

texts.en:
Alford S. is from the city of Capatan Tuguegarao, City. He is 43 years old. Alford is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Alford operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing repair services to local community members. Alford has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities.

In 2009, Alford joined ASKI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alford is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Alford from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Apai

texts.en:
Apai M. currently sells food in a hotel and is requesting a loan to purchase crates of beer and sodas, water, etc., to sell. Apai is 26 years old and is married to a taxi driver. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up another big hotel.

About BRAC: BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase crates of beer and sodas, water, etc.

loans.name: Debora Auma

texts.en:
Debora Auma G. is a charcoal dealer in the Rongo market, Kenya. She is 24 years old, is married, and is the mother of two children.

Debora Auma’s former business was shoe-selling but the business did not do well. Thus she moved into the lucrative business, she says, of charcoal dealing.

Debora Auma would like a loan of Kshs 30,000 which will go into expanding her charcoal business as well as reviving her old shoe business.

loans.use: To expand her charcoal business as well as to revive her shoe business

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto T., 53, is making sure that his family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Melba T., he is blessed with three children. He is making sure that his family will have a better future. He has been selling fruits and vegetables for more than a year.

Alberto has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. He regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays his weekly dues consistently. Because of his good repayment performance with his previous loans, he was able to borrow  a few times in CCT’s Cooperative, a Kiva partner. He is consistent in paying his dues because he used the money he borrowed to buy assorted fruits and vegetables from wholesalers. His business lets him earn a profit of 15,000 Philippine pesos per month.  

Now with your help, he would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to his expanding business by allowing him to buy more stock of assorted fruits and vegetables.

He dreams that his earnings from his business will continue to grow so that he can continue to finance his children's education until they finish college. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buying more stock of assorted fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en:
Zahid R. is a 46-year-old entrepreneur who runs his own car washing service. He has nine years of experience in this field and two years ago he was able to build his own car wash, thanks to his hard work and long years of experience in this field.

Zahid is married and has three children who are the meaning of his life. Now Zahid would like to expand his business and purchase new and modern car-washing tools. For this purpose he applied for 160 AZN. Be an important part of Zahid`s business.

loans.use: To purchase new and modern car-washing tools

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda J. is 34 years old and is a sari-sari store owner. She is borrowing her seventh loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc, where she has been a client for seven years. She would like to improve her business, and hopes to receive a loan of 20,000 so she can buy additional merchandise. She hopes that by offering her customers a wider selection, she can then attract more customers and improve her sales.

loans.use: Additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Carlos Ariel

texts.es:
En el barrio Germán pomares  Municipio de Somotillo 
El señor Carlos Ariel G. M.  realiza su trabajo como mecánico en la alcaldía de este municipio dándole mantenimiento a toda la maquinaria pesada y a vehículos livianos de esta institucion.
 El quiere el crédito para comprar la compra de 30 bolsas de cemento para la finalización de una obra que el esta llevando acabo en casa de habitación.
El nos dice que los créditos que a recibido en CEPRODEL lo han beneficiado en la construcción de su vivienda y su acondicionamiento.
texts.en:
In the German Pomares neighborhood of Somotillo Mr. Carlos Ariel Garcia M. works as a mechanic in the Somotillo mayor's office, maintaining all the heavy machinery and light vehicles there. He would like the loan to buy 30 bags of cement to finish work he his doing on his home. He tells us that the loans he has received from CEPRODEL have benefitted the construction and renovation of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 30 bags of cement to finish construction he is doing on his home

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial tiene 30 años de edad, actualmente vive con su pareja y madre de sus tres hijos. Su casa, la cual está aun en construcción está ubicada en la hermosa selva tropical cusqueña.

Marcial es un hombre lleno de ganas y fuerzas por querer llegar lo más lejos posible. En el presente trabaja en la Municipalidad de su localidad, específicamente en el área de construcción. Le gusta lo que realiza, ya que gracias a ello recibe una remuneración justa, para poder cubrir las necesidades de su hogar y llevar felicidad a su familia. Para el futuro desea ser independiente y tener su propio negocio, implementando una tienda de abarrotes donde trabaje junto a su esposa.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con las cuotas en las fechas establecidas. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en la construcción de su casa, con la finalidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcial is 30 years old. He currently lives with the mother of their three children. His house, which is still under construction, is in the beautiful tropical jungle cusqueña (frontier or province). Marcial is a man full of desires and strengths to go as far as possible. Today he works for a nearby town in the field of construction. He likes his work and receives fair compensation, with which he pays for necessary household expenses and brings happiness to his family. In the future, he wishes to be independent and have his own business by setting up a grocery store where he and his wife can work together. This is his first loan with MFP (local lending institution); he is committed to making his payments on time. This money will be invested in the construction of his house, with the purpose of improving his family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of his house

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 49 years old and married with three children. He and his family live in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. He has been selling car spare parts. He also sells used car spare parts. Ali asked for a loan to purchase more car spare parts to sell. He hopes to grow his business to become bigger and stronger. This is his third loan and he has always paid on time. Thanks to his previous loans, he was able to diversify his merchandise and expand his stock so that he can meet his clients’ demands. His clients can be anyone from his region. He decided to open his business because of his experience. His plans for the future are to keep on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda S. is from the village of Misom Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Luzminda is single and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Luzminda raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luzminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase feed for the pigs. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional pigs to raise. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Luzminda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Doña Susana, de 50 años, está casada con Felipe de 66 años, juntos viene en su casa propia, ambos tienen 9 hijos, quienes ya trabajan y viven de manera independiente pero habitan cerca en la localidad Dos de Mayo. Hace más de 25 años, se dedican a cuidar los cultivos de café, plátanos y palta que están sobre sus propios terrenos y en época de cosecha, su esposo la ayuda en la recolección de su producción e incluso puede calcular cuanto de ganancias obtendrá al comercializarlos, sin embargo lo más pesado es tener que cargar y transportar su cosecha al punto de venta. Para ella la agricultura le es rentable, gracias a eso ha podido educar a sus hijos y brindarles una adecuada calidad de vida, asimismo pudo comprar el espacio donde viven actualmente y son muy felices. Con el tiempo espera comprar chacras para plantar café y así incrementar su productividad, ya que esto le asegurará una vejez tranquila al lado de sus queridos hijos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y está feliz de ser parte de un grupo tan bien conformado, donde todos sus integrantes se dan la mano ante cualquier dificultad, por eso le agrada laborar a lado de ellos. Con el crédito que solicita, acopiará café de sus vecinos, en donde los hará secar para luego revenderlo.
texts.en:
Susana is 50 years old. She is married to 66 year old Felipe and they have nine adult children who live near the “Dos de Mayo” neighborhood. For the past 25 years she has been raising coffee, bananas, and avocados on their own land. Her husband helps her with the harvest and figures out how much they will earn from the sale. The most difficult part is transporting the harvest to the point of sale. For her, farming is profitable, and she has been able to provide an education and provide an adequate quality of life for her children. It also allowed her to be able to buy the space in which they currently live and they are very happy. Eventually she would like to buy fields where she can raise coffee and increase her production and help to ensure that she can live comfortably in her old age, alongside her children. This will be her second loan through MFP and she is happy to be able to be a part of such a well formed group, where all of its members lend a hand during any difficulty. She will use the money from this loan to buy coffee from her neighbors, which she will dry and resell.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Coffee for resale

loans.name: Amidgar

texts.es: El Sr. A. C. Amidgar vive en el Sector la Hacienda Vieja, perteneciente al distrito de Santiago, junto a su esposa y su  hijo. Trabaja en el fundo IQF. su esposa tambien trabaja como obrera de campo desde hace 2 años. Solicita financiamiento para  la construcción  de su vivienda, ya que gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo a podido construir parte de su vivienda. Su sueño es poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida para su familia y brindarle educación a su hija. El Sr. A. C. Amidgar agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a travez de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Amidgar lives with his wife and son in the La Hacienda Vieja sector, of the Santiago district. He works for the IQF. His wife also works as a field laborer and has done so for two years. He is asking for this loan in order to finish building his home. Thanks to hard work and effort, he has been able to build part of it. He wants to be able to provide a better quality of life for his family and provide an education for his daughter. Amidgar is grateful for the support he has gotten through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Mrs. Chin R., aged 27, owns and operates a handicraft business with the main activity being the sale of rattan cupboards. She sells rattan that her husband weaves or she orders from other weavers who live in the village. She uses her horse cart for transportation and it takes a week to sell all her rattan.

Mrs. Chin R. has been facing difficulties transporting her rattan because her horse cart is slow and this affects her ability to satisfy the needs of her customers. Because of this problem, she decided to request a loan to purchase a dragging machine to which she will attach her existing cart, so she can transport her product more quickly. She is a good mother to her two school-aged children. She was busy when the photo was taken so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase a dragging machine

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia trabaja como empleada domestica en la zona sur, su esposo trabaja en el interior como albañil, es su fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la  manutención de sus tres hijos, tiene su casa propia ubicado en  la zona 16 de febrero de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará para la compra de material de construcción, para continuar trabajando en su vivienda.
 
Es el tercer crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Alicia works as a maid in the southern region and her husband works as a builder. With their income they support their three children. She owns her house, which is in the 16 de febrero zone in the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase construction materials to continue working on her home. It is her third loan with IMPRO. Making her payments responsibly has made it possible to be approved for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover the cost of construction materials to continue work on her home

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive junto a sus padres en la ciudad de Lambayeque, una zona de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a brindar servicio de tipeos, impresiones y escaneados en su vivienda, para realizar su trabajo cuenta con una computadora equipada, esta actividad cuenta con bastante acogida en la ciudad ya que en ella se encuentra instalada la universidad más grande de la región y los estudiantes siempre requieren de estos servicios para poder realizar de mejor modo sus labores.

Julio realiza sus trabajos de modo responsable y trata en lo posible de brindar un buen servicio, por estas razones ya cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles que siempre acuden a el cuando necesitan que les tipeen algún trabajo o cuando necesitan imprimirlo. Con los ingresos que el obtiene de esta actividad solventa sus gastos personales y ayuda a sus padres a solventar la economía del hogar.

El continuo uso brindado a sus máquinas ha hecho que estas empiecen a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, además Julio desea adquirir algunos útiles de oficina con los cuales pueda implementar su negocio, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su objetivo.

Julio es un joven trabajador y responsable, en la zona donde viven sus vecinos y clientes le tienen mucha estima y le consideran alguien confiable.
texts.en:
Julio, age 28, is single and has no children. He lives with his parents in the city of Lambayeque. It is an area with plenty of commercial activity, which is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For three years he has been providing typing, printing, and scanning services in his house. To do his work he has a fully equipped computer. This activity is well received in the city because the largest university in the area is located there. The students always need these services to be able to do their work in the best way. Julio works in a responsible way. He does whatever he can to offer good service. That is why he now has a group of loyal customers. They always go to him when they need their work typed or when they need to print it. With the income he gets from this activity he pays for his personal expenses and helps his parents with the household finances. The continual use of his machines has caused them to start having some problems, which require urgent repair in order to guarantee that they work correctly. Also, Julio wants to get some office supplies, which he can use in his business. That is why he is asking Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for a loan for 1,000 soles. The loan will help him achieve his objective. Julio is a hard-working and responsible young man. In the area where he lives his neighbors and his customers hold him in high esteem and consider him to be trustworthy. .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Computer maintenance and office supplies to improve his typing and scanning business

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn S. is from the village of D'ban Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Merlyn is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving local food to customers in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Merlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food & drinks for the restaurant.

loans.name: Demostenes

texts.en:
Demostenes T. is from the town of Talibon. He is 30 years old. Demostenes is single. To make a living, Demostenes owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish at the market. Demostenes has been engaged in his business for over 10 years. He is planning to grow hogs for fattening and sale. He says he works hard to save for his future family as he also plans to have his own family someday.

Demostenes joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Demostenes is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. He also plans to buy piglets to start raising hogs. This will be the first loan taken out by Demostenes from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets, and piglets to start raising hogs

loans.name: Anwer's Group

texts.en:
Anwer, a 35-year-old mother of a 7-year-old daughter, lives in a small town of Pakpattan Pakistan named Hassan Poora. Married to M. I., she resides in a two-room brick house with her family.

Her husband is a private entrepreneur who has dealt with blankets and carpets for the past ten years, buying his products from Lahore and supplying them to various cities including Islamabad and Faisalabad. His customers are very satisfied with him due to the quality of items he sells.

Anwer herself is also a very hardworking and good-natured lady. She runs a small grocery shop adjacent to her home from which she sells daily use items such as tea, sugar, cooking oil, candies and chips. She started this business in order to support her husband financially.

Anwer is now requesting a loan from Asasah for her husband, who plans to buy blankets because the winter season is approaching and he hopes to earn additional profits by making an investment in his business. A new loan applicant of Asasah, Anwer hopes this will be a beneficial experience that will enable her to soon send her daughter to school with the increased income of her husband’s business.

Note: In the picture, Anwer is shown raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase blankets for re-selling

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Rosendo ; el tiene 42  años de edad y es viudo y tiene 1 hijo, el socio trabaja como maestro de obras de construcción, hace diferentes obras en lugares como Cusco y en Urubamba por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a su hijo, el socio quiere tener un terreno de cultivo. El socio solicita el préstamo para  comprar herramientas para su trabajo de maestro de construcción y también para la mantención de su hijo. 

	
El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Virgen del Carmen dy Yuncaypata". The bank is located in the community of Yuncaypata, which is in the Cusco province and the department of Cusco. The member is Rosendo. He is 42 years old and is a widower with one son. He works as a construction foreman and works at various locations like Cusco and Urubamba. This work enables him to give the best to his son. He wants to have some land to cultivate. The member is requesting a loan to buy tools for his work as a construction foreman and also to support his son. He is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this loan, and he promises to make his repayments according the the established timetable.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to buy tools for his work as a construction foreman and also to support his son.

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en:
Nergui B. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Arhangai province of Mongolia.  He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  His two daughters, ages 15 and 9, both attend the local school while his wife works as a nurse for the local hospital. 

Nergui started his own business in 2004 operating a grocery shop with a working capital of 1,500,000 MNT and since 2008, he has been operating a picture frame and souvenir item trading business after moving to his current town. In opening his current business, his working capital increased to 3,000,000 MNT. He used it to purchase necessary equipment for his current business.  He produces a variety of picture frames and souvenir items of good quality therefore his sales are high in the local market.  He is an honest man and says, “all I want is to have my own factory."  Nergui is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary materials, tools and supplies for his business.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials and tools

loans.name: Mayra Guadalupe

texts.es: Doña Mayra Guadalupe es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. La señora tiene un negocio que es la venta de ropa y cosméticos, el cual está localizado en su casa de habitación y de manera ambulante. La señora dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 6 años, Ella empezó con este negocio, después de que unas amigas le enseñaran este medio de vida que es importante y sus mismas amigas le enviaban clientes para que practicara y se diera a conocer. Después fue ampliando su negocio, ya que ofrecía un buen servicio y los mismos clientes se encargaban de enviarles a otros clientes. El crédito solicitado por la señora será invertido en la compra de polvos, faldas, pantalones, camisas y trajes. El sueño que tiene la señora, es ampliar su negocio que brinde mayor estabilidad económica a ella y a su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Mayra Guadalupe is a single mother to 4 underage children who are under her care. She has a business selling clothing and makeup that is located in her home and as a street vendor. Mrs. Mayra began this business 6 years ago, after some friends taught her that this work was important and they also sent her customers so that she could practice and make herself known. Later, she began expanding her business, since it offered good service and the same customers sent her new ones. The loan by Mrs. Mayra is to buy face powders, skirts, pants, shirts and dresses. Her dream is to expand her business and to give her and her family more economic stability.

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Keji

texts.en: Keji M. is currently in the business of selling beans and tomatoes and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans and rice to sell. Keji is 28 years old and is widowed. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a car for hire.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Vet's Group

texts.en:
This village loan is made up of nine people. They are located in the Preaek Reang village in the Kandal province. This village loan, selected Mrs. Vet S. L., a 31-year-old married woman, as the village bank president. The members of this village will use their money for different purposes.

Mrs. Vet S. L. is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of rice field where she cultivates rice. To support this farming, she would like to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and gasoline to grow rice. Aside from farming, she also raises fish and sells grocery at home. With her businesses, she is able to earn a little income to support her famiL.. Her husband, Mr. Sot Sien, 31, works as a fisherman and also helps his wife with her current careers.

This couple has a child who is three years old.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizer and gasoline to grow rice.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah B. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Peninah has a tailoring business. She has been in this business for eight years, and she works seven days out of every week. Peninah sells her products in a shop on a retail basis.  

Peninah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more clothing materials. The main business challenges for Peninah include the rainy season and the ever-increasing prices of clothing materials. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only. 

Peninah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials

loans.name: Nadya

texts.en:
Nadya G. lives in Gandzakar village, in the Ijevan area. She is married and has 3 sons. 

One of Nadya's sons helps her run a flower trading business, which Nadya has been managing since 1994. She runs her business from a rented stall in the Ijevan central market, where it is always very populous. 

Thanks to the business income, Nadya was able to support her family and buy a car for her business.  Having a car has made delivering flowers from Yerevan to Ijevan easier, and has cut down her business costs.    

Unfortunately, recently Nadya and her son had a little accident.  Now Nadya is asking for a 600,000 AMD loan to repair their car, which is very necessary for them in their business.

loans.use: To repair car, used for flower delivery

loans.name: Tania Alejandra

texts.es: Tania Alejandra tiene 32 años, pues su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general.  Ella es bien emprendedora y disfruta de tener este medio de vida para mantener a su hijo menor de edad. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre le están solicitando diferentes productos que son necesarios para su negocio, ella es una mujer muy responsable y disfruta mucho de interactuar con sus clientes. En la actualidad continua con este negocio. Este crédito es para la compra de productos como calzado, cosméticos, ropa, sabanas entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Tania Alejandra is 32 years old.  Her business activity is selling general merchandise.  She is a very enterprising lady and she enjoys this way of supporting her child who is still a minor.  Her customers are always asking her for different products that are necessary for her business.  She is a very responsible woman and she very much enjoys interacting with her customers.  She is currently continuing with this business.  This loan will be used to buy products such as footwear, cosmetics, clothes, sheets, etc.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Philister

texts.en: Philister is 37 years old, married and a mother of two.  For eleven years, she has been cooking and selling chips in her food stall in Kibera slums. She says that she is a devoted Christian who is optimistic in life. Her aspirations is to open a wholesale shop for selling shoes in the future.  She has requested for 20,000 Kes to buy cooking fat and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat and potatoes

loans.name: Job Wafula

texts.en:
Job Wafula M. is 59 years old, married to Phoebe Omunya and together they have three children.  His family lives in Milima in the outskirts of Kitale town, and Job's wife Phoebe does baking business while Job is a capenter in Kitale. He has been in this business for ten years and gets a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This will be Job's first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use the entire loan to buy timber that will be used for his capentry work, with the interest that he will get he plans to save and buy a plane machine which he will use to smoothen the wood. 

In future he wants to diversify and start a different business, which he is still thinking about, and he also wants to start a family business where each member of the family can work and be paid.

loans.use: To buy timber  for capentry work

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C. is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a general store and a fishing business. She lives in Brooke's Point, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Elizabeth is now borrowing PHP 14,000 to purchase more items for resale. This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Elizabeth aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more items for resale

loans.name: Kura

texts.en:
Kura is a widow with seven children – three are adults while four still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Kura has been operating a food vending business for the past six years, selling at the market, from home, as well as from door to door to her neighbours. Kura faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to become a poultry farmer in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, Kura wants to purchase blocks and sand to build a shelter to sell food and to repair her house. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build food stall, and to repair house

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman with nine school-going children. They live in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbours. Dama faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.es:
Jennifer nació en la ciudad de Lima y tiene 22 años de edad. Actualmente, Jennifer vive en la ciudad imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú), ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad económica principal es la venta de productos de belleza. Ya es un año y medio que trabaja en este negocio y va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Jennifer en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos de belleza. 

Jennifer es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Ana Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Jennifer was born in the city of Lima and is 22 years old. Currently, Jennifer lives in the imperial city of the Incas (Cusco, Perú). She is a responsible mother who is working to get her family ahead. Her main business activity is selling beauty products. She has been in this line of work for a year and a half and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. Jennifer at this time requires a loan to purchase more beauty products. 

Jennifer is a responsible person who belongs to the “Ana Jarvis III” communal bank of the "Asociación Arariwa" in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 52-year-old widow with three children: Sofia, 21 years old, Frengky, 20 years old and Asnat, 18 years old and working in Bali. Susana lives with Frengky’s family in Pukdale Village – Kupang District.

Prior to running a kiosk business. Susana worked in a rice field. Due to the fact that the harvest had to be shared with the landowner, Susana could only generate a small income and so decided to initiate a kiosk business at her house. With IDR 2,000,000 that she had, she bought some products to sell at her kiosk. As a widow, Susana has to work hard in her business to meet her family needs; moreover, she also needs to support her grandchild.

Currently Susana plans to sell ice cube and mixed ice at her kiosk but needs a refrigerator to produce them. She received information that TLM has assisted many small entrepreneurs in improving their businesses, so she is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 to purchase the refrigerator. Susana is hoping that TLM will approve her loan application.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to produce ice cube for sale

loans.name: Ziborah

texts.en: Ziborah N. W., 31, married and a mother of two lovely children, lives with her family in Matisi, on the outskirts of Kitale. For two years she has been selling groceries to the people of Kitale, earning a monthly income of three thousand shillings. This will be Ziborah's first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to purchase more stock for her business including tomatoes, onions, fruits and vegetables. In the future she wants to expand her business and also educate her children.

loans.use: to add more stock such as tomatoes, fruits, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Lidier

texts.es: Lidier M. Solís, tiene la edad de 26 años, está casado, vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposa que son sus mayores prioridades. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para la asistencia del tiquizque. El cuenta con el terreno y la experiencia necesario para realizar esta siembra, por lo cual  quiere sembrar una buena cantidad de este cultivo para así obtener ganancias, pues actualmente se encuentra bien pagado. El quiere lograr ganancias para seguir adelante con sus proyectos y darle a su familia una calidad de vida mejor y seguir creciendo como persona y como agricultor. Es el segundo préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Lidier M. Solís is 26 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and two children, who represent his greatest priority in life. He has requested the loan to purchase the necessary materials for growing tequizque. He has the land and experience necessary for growing the plant, of which he wants to grow a substantial quantity to produce a good profit. At present, tequizque commands high prices. He wants to secure a good profit, and thus be able to continue with his projects, offer a better quality of life to his family, and to develop both as a person and farmer. This will be his second loan with FUDECOSUR. He has never had any other loans from state-run banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with good conditions and low interest rates.

loans.use: to pay for help and manual labour costs.

loans.name: Peresi

texts.en: Peresi sells green vegetables.  She is 36 years-old and married with five children and all of them go to school.  Peresi took a loan in order to stock more greens to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profit generated.

loans.use: to stock more greens to sell.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda, 35, is married and has five children. Three are in school.

Daylinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net and an engine for her pump boat. (A pump boat is an outrigger canoe powered by a small engine.)

Daylinda has been in this business for two years. In the future, Daylinda would like to save money for the future and the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy an engine for the pump boat and some fish net.

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es:
Maria es comerciante, su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosmeticos, que durante veinte años, vende en donde comenzo con la venta de piñatas, electrodomestico, con capital propio que sus hijos dieron. 
Atraves de los años ha venido manteniendo y invirtiendo en su capital, con prestamo que Afodenic ha otorgado en siete ciclos, lo que para ella ha sido un éxito.
Hoy en dia tiene poca mercaderia y desea comprar, una docena de toallas de baño, sabanas, una docena de camisetas, bolsos grandes,camisones de dormir, perfumes entre otros encargos para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.Ya que tiene que cubrir sus gastos, basicos de la casa y gastos personales, teniendo la ayuda economica de sus hijos tambien.
texts.en:
Maria is a vendor and sells clothing and cosmetics.  She began selling piñatas and domestic appliances twenty years ago with capital her children gave her.

Over the years she has been able to maintain and invest her capital, and Afodenic has given her loans on seven occasions which have also contributed to her success.

She currently has only a little merchandise on hand and wants to buy a dozen bath towels, sheets, a dozen t-shirts, big bags, nightgowns, perfumes and other items that customers are ordering.  She has to cover household and personal expenses, and also receives some economical support from her children.

loans.use: To buy clothing and cosmetics to increase sales.

loans.name: Zarbubu

texts.en:
Zarbubu is a very good-natured woman. She is 53, married and has five children. She lives in Zhany-Korgon village in the south of Kyrgyzstan and is engaged in cattle breeding and land cultivating. She started with initial capital of 10,000 soms (KGS) which was used to purchase a heifer. Being a persistent person, Zarbubu works hard to enlarge her business and achieve success – today she has two milk cows and a calf. 

Zarbubu plans to use this loan of 60,000 KGS to expand her herd and purchase mineral fertilizers that will lead to an increased harvest and top quality products. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Sifa

texts.en:
Sifa is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past five years, Sifa has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business. His potential customers are neighbors and passers-by. He faces the major challenge of competition from other motorcycle businesses. Sifa dreams of establishing a motorcycle spare parts shop in the future.
With his loan of 10,000 KES, Sifa wants to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle. He decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Elga Eby

texts.en: Elga lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras with her three children. For the last seven years, she has operated a small business selling undergarments, shoes, and dishware at the local market. Elga is requesting a loan of HNL 15,000 to purchase undergarments, sandals, and dishware for her store. She hopes the loan she receives will help expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase undergarments, sandals, and dishware.

loans.name: Kashipa

texts.en:
Kashipa has been selling milk in Emali for the last five years. She is a 35-year-old married woman blessed with three children, all of whom attend school.

Kashipa was introduced to KADET by a KADET client. This will be her first loan, which she plans to use to buy supplies of milk. In the future, Kashipa hopes to own milking cows and practice dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy a supply of milk.

loans.name: Pablito

texts.en:
Pablito is a married man with two children who are 15 and 16 years old. He has been a farmer for 30 years now. Pablito plants rice, corn and cassava on his land. He sells his harvest at his town’s market.

Pablito requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Pablito hopes to grow his business. He also wishes for his family to be happy and healthy always.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Chanry

texts.en:
Chanry (in the photo) and her husband, Nget, live in a village outside of Phnom Penh City. They have two young children: one son and one daughter. 

Chanry is a garment worker, while her husband is a construction. She is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Makhmoud

texts.fr: Monsieur Makhmoud est  un homme de 34 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Il évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis 10 ans. Il pratique la vente de  produits originaires d'un pays limitrophe du Sénégal tels qu’habits, portables et divers autres. En même temps il pratique la riziculture dans la vallée du fleuve Sénégal. Il est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juillet 2008. Il a déjà remboursé 3 crédits antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits  qu’il va revendre   . La majeur partie de sa clientèle se trouve dans la Capitale et dans une région qui se situe non loin du lieu ou il se procure ses produits.   Ce financement  pourra lui permettre de mieux rentabiliser son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
Mr. Makhmoud is a 34-year-old man who lives in Senegal. He has been working in business for ten years selling products, such as clothing, mobile phones, and a variety of other goods that originate from the neighboring country of Senegal. At the same time, he works at rice farming in Senegal’s river valley. 

He has been a member of a U-IMCEC branch since July 2008 and has already repaid three previous loans. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for buying goods that he is going to resell. Most of his customer base is found in the capital and in a region located near where he acquires his products. This financing will enable him to make his business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy clothing and mobile phones to resell

loans.name: Maqsoodan's Group

texts.en:
Maqsoodan is a 43-year-old lady who supports her family with her sewing business. She operates her business from her home. Her earnings allow her to pay the education fees for her children so they can continue their education and improve their lives. 
 
Maqsoodan has four children: three daughters and one son. Her eldest daughter has completed her education to 10th standard and now works as a nurse in order to financially contribute to the family. Her second daughter is in 10th standard, while her younger daughter is in 9th standard. Her son is not yet old enough to attend school.
 
Her husband is a driver. He drives a rickshaw and provides transportation to his passengers. He has been in this profession for the past ten years. Maqsoodan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will repair his rickshaw because it is currently not operating properly and doesn’t allow him to drive on longer routes. With a fully-repaired rickshaw, her husband will be able to continue his business and provide his services to more passengers.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh, 58 years old, is widowed and has two daughters. She lives with her children in Ho Chi Minh City.

She supports her family with the income that she earns from her general store in front of her door. She intends to use her loan to buy more kinds of products such as green tea, sugar, milk and spices to sell for her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell such as green tea, sugar, milk and spices.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a very hard-working woman who has practiced mixed farming for more than six years. She is 37 years old, married, and has three children. She is applying for her first loan. She plans to use part of the loan amount to buy farm inputs and the other part to run a dairy milk shop. 

She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Maricel has a shop that buys and sells gold dust. She is also doing "pamiling" or filtering gold dust in the river. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy gold dust to sell.

Maricel has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Maricel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy gold dust to sell.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 63 years old, a widow with 5 adult children. She is from Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

To make a living, Rizalina owns and operates a farmland, planting & harvesting corn for sale. She's been in this business for 20 years and earns 15,000 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Rizalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Rizalina is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This will be the 29th loan taken out by Rizalina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Amaan

texts.en:
Amaan is 25 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. His wife is a clerk and his son is a kindergarten student. 

Amaan started his transportation business in early 2010, using his own vehicle, transporting between cities. His business income is enough to support his family. However, his vehicle is now having problems and it needs to be serviced. Amaan is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to service his vehicle. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I'm having a crisis. My engine is giving me problems and it could shut down at any time."

loans.use: To service his vehicle.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with two children, all of whom graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past five years, she has operated a business selling clothes door-to-door to her neighbors and passers-by. She dreams of establishing a stall for selling clothes in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Being a responsible mother, Venus aims to improve her family's status of living and give her children a bright future. She owns and manages a restaurant in the community cooking and selling meals, snacks and souvenir items. She is now 30 years old and has three infant-age children. With her husband, they aim to improve their small restaurant in order to increase their income and satisfy their customers demand.

Due to insufficient capital, Venus is asking for an additional P 50,000 to buy pork, vegetables, fish, seasoning, cup of noodles, soft drinks, coffee and bread to be cooked and sold in their restaurant. She believes that through patience and strong determination they will improve the business and make it a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy pork, vegetables, fish, seasoning, cup of noodles, soft drinks, coffee and bread to be cooked and sold in her restaurant.

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.
Nemesia has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing net and other materials for fishing. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Heremakono 7 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe HEREMAKONO 7  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  32 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FAKOLA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: l’arachide et le mais avec FATOUMATA SALIM la 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 1/2 hectare. La production est vendue à FAKOLA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et frais de labours pour la campagne agricole.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia is a vegetable grower from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She finds pleasure in doing her farming activities and earn as well for her family. As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she has seek financial help to pay for land and seedbed preparatios.In the future, Ofelia wishes to become the supplier of vegetables in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.en:
Maria Cristina is a woman of superior strength and with an engaging and proactive spirit. Despite all of the difficult moments she had to go through, she never stopped moving forward. It has not been at all easy, but she has made it. Some years ago her husband passed away and she was left alone with one of their children, while the others were already married. Following this situation she looked for a business that would generate the necessary earnings for the daily sustenance of her children and herself and no longer have to depend on the occasional help provided by her other children.

It has already been six years since Maria Cristina started to sell foods she herself made in her home. Now she requires a loan of $250 to be able to buy ingredients needed to make her products and therefore increase her earnings and be able to continue on with her daily struggle. The time has come for you to make your decision to help her. The decision is in your hands, you now only need to make your decision.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María Cristina es una mujer con mucha fortaleza y con un espíritu emprendedor y proactivo, pues a pesar de los difíciles momentos por los que ha tenido que atravesar, nunca se ha dejado vencer y a seguido adelante, no ha sido nada fácil, pero lo ha logrado. Hace algunos años su esposo falleció y ella se quedó sola con uno de sus hijos, los demás ya estaban casados, ante esta situación ella buscó una actividad que le generará los ingresos necesarios para el sustento diario de ella y sus hijos y no depender de la eventual ayuda que le proporcionaban sus otros hijos.

Ya son 6 años desde que María Cristina inició con la venta de comidas que ella misma elabora en su propia casa. Ahora ella requiere de un crédito de $250 DLLS para poder comprar los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de sus productos y así incrementar sus ingresos y poder continuar en la lucha diaria. Es momento de que te decidas apoyarla, la decisión esta en tus manos, sólo hace falta que te decidas.

loans.use: purchase mercandise

loans.name: Dora Elia

texts.en:
Dora is a married woman with three children. They were the reason she started her business eight years ago. He husband is a watchman in a carwash in the cit of Monclava, Coahuila where they are both from. His income was not enough to support the family. Dora is an enterprising woman with the desire to improve the lives of her family. Because of this, she started preparing and selling foods such as tomales, chorizo and hamburgers. Little by little her business grew and her clients requested that she add elotes and games for children on her menu.

Actually, the entire family works in the business to help Dora and because of this, she has increased her clientele. In order to keep the business growing, Dora is asking for a loan of $475 to change the cart used to carry merchandise for a small truck. Dora is preparing to repay this loan in 5 to 10 months and hopes for your help to improve and continue to increase her business.

Dora es una mujer casada y tiene 3 hijos, quienes fueron la razón para empezar con su negocio hace ya ocho años atrás. Su esposo trabaja como vigilante en un auto lavado en la ciudad de Monclava, Coahuila de donde ambos son originarios y sus ingresos no eran suficientes para mantener el sustento de toda su familia, por lo que Dora siendo una mujer emprendedora y con ganas de salir adelante y conociendo el oficio de preparar comida decidió abrir un pequeño puesto de venta de tamales, chorizo y hamburguesas inicialmente y poco a poco en lo que mejoraba su negocio y a pedido de su clientela incremento su menú a la venta de elotes y puso unas maquinitas de juegos para los niños.

Actualmente toda la familia trabaja en el negocio para ayudar a dora y por que se ha incrementado su clientela, por ello para seguir creciendo Dora solicita un préstamo por US $ 475 para cambiar el carrito que tiene para cargar mercancía por una camioneta pequeña. Dora ofrece pagar este préstamo en un período de 5 a 10 meses y espera de su ayuda para poder mejorar y continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use:
Change the vehicle used for sales

cambiar el vehículo que utiliza para la venta

loans.name: Chrang

texts.en: Mr Chrang T. T. is 24 years old and works construction in Phnom Penh.  He and his wife have 2 young children that they send to school daily.  Chrang is seeking this loan so that he can purchase some construction tools.  He hopes to one day become a construction foreman, and then he will have enough money to build a new house for his family and send his children to university.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue to diversify her product line

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
For the past 13 years, I have been stitching clothes for my neighborhood clients. My husband operates a catering shop. He started this business a couple of years ago by taking a loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution. The income improved and enabled us to bring three meals on our table everyday.

I have two children who are not old enough to attend school. When they grow old enough, I will send them to school for sure.

We wish to expand our catering business because the wedding season will start right after the Eid (a Muslim festival). Thus, we need a $200 USD loan to buy additional items such as new tents, carpets, etc. that are required to take on big orders.

loans.use: To expand the catering business

loans.name: Mankaa

texts.en:
Mankaa E. was born in 1979 and is a single mother of one child. As the eldest daughter of the family, she has had a lot of difficulty covering her responsibilities because she has made very little profit from her small business selling food items.

With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), she plans to invest in this business and even sell body lotions. The profit will be used to support and feed her family and to pay school fees for her child.

She plans to repay the loan in 12-15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase materials to construct a booth, buy drugs and cosmetics

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg supports his wife and two children with a small office supplies business in the little village of Pocrovskoe near Nicopol, Ukraine. Oleg has been in business for about seven years. He has a good location near the center of town and has benefited from not having direct competition from other vendors.

Oleg has requested a loan of $1200 to purchase a new supply of inventory for his business. He has proven to be a hard-working entrepreneur who has been able to develop a stable, growing business. We are happy for this new opportunity to assist him in continuing the success of his business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase goods for sale

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita R. C. sells beef, pork, and chicken in the rural town of Caserio Shucshuyecu in the region of San Martin. She’s been running the business with her husband for many years. They now have loyal clients in many surrounding towns including Moyobamba the capital of the San Martin region.

Anita is 45 years old, happily married, and has 6 children. Three of her children are independent and the other three are studying. She is happy she’s had the opportunity to work with her family over the years. She is also happy with all the friends she has made working in such a social business.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Responsables, Anita is requesting a loan of $1,050 (s/3000) to repay over 6 months. The extra capital will give her the opportunity to buy more meat to sell and provide a better service.

loans.use: The loan will give her the opportunity to buy more meat to sell and to provide better service.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German is a tailor; he makes men's suits that are sold in Bolivia Santa Cruz and Cochabamba. His wife helps him to sell the suits during the feria on July 16th in the city of El Alto. In this way he earns the income with which he supports their two children. He lives in the Las Nieves area of the city of La Paz.

The requested loan will be used to buy a sewing machine which will help him to meet the demand in his market.

This is his fifth loan with Impro. His good loan history qualifies German for another loan. German has been a client of ours since 2001.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

German es costurero; confecciona trajes para varón los cuales son comercializados en el interior de Bolivia Santa Cruz y Cochabamba; la esposa ayuda comercializando los trajes en la feria 16 de julio de la Ciudad de El Alto. De esta manera logran sus ingresos con los que cubre la manutención de sus dos hijos; vive en la Zona Las Nieves de la Ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito solicitado será utilizado para comprar una maquina recta de coser misma que le ayudara para satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.

Es el quinto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite aprobarlo otro préstamo. German es cliente nuestro desde el año 2001.

loans.use: Sewing machine for tailor’s shop

loans.name: Zebo
