texts.ru:
Zebo K., 47, lives in Rudaki district. She is married and has four children. Zebo sells food products for a living. She has a trading stall at the "Safari" market in Dushanbe. Her husband is working in Russia at the moment, so Zebo must take full responsibility for her family. She has a good spot at the market and her business is well organized. The only lack is in her assortment of goods. Zebo is applying for a loan in order to increase her sales volume. She can repay the loan within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Косимова Зебо проживает в районе Рудаки. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Имеет торговую точку на рынке «Сафари» города Душанбе.Муж ее уехал в Россию на заработки , поэтому ответственность за ее семью лежит полностью на Зебо. У нее хорошее место и бизнес налажен. Только не хватает ассортимента товара. Поэтому она планирует получить кредит, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. А погасить кредит сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase sales volume

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.en:
Ana Francisca is a hard working and ambitious entrepreneur who struggles to proviD. a better life for her family. She has a nineteen-year-old son who’ll start his university studies in a couple of months.

Soon after her husband passed away five years ago, Ana Francisca had to face the hard reality of raising a child on her own. She started a small business of selling arepas (unleavened corn-flour flatbread) from her home. Currently, this entrepreneur’s business is successful and her clientele keeps growing.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy corn flour, sugar, milk, cocoa and other ingredients in bulk to keep producing her tasty arepas and satisfy her customers’ needs. Ana Francisca hopes that her business will help allow her improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her arepas in bulk

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
For the past 5 years Elena has been making and repairing clothing, a trade she learned from her mother. When she became unemployed she started working at this full time since her husband earned very little and they did not have enough income to cover all their expenses.

She needs a loan for US $250, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy work supplies such as buttons, material and thread. Now that the school year is coming to an end she will offer her services to make outfits for graduation. With your help, Elena will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Elena tiene 5 años dedicándose a la elaboración de ropa y arreglo de la misma este oficio lo aprendió de su madre ya que cuando ella se quedo sin trabajo se dedico de lleno a esta actividad, debido a que su marido gana poco y no les alcanza con su sueldo para solventar los gastos del hogar.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses, para compra material de trabajo como botones, telas, hilos, ya que vienen los fines de curso de las escuelas y buscara ofrecer sus servicios para elaborar los trajes de graduacion. Con tu ayuda Elena saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase work supplies.

loans.name: Ikrom.

texts.ru:
Ikrom N. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is married and has 5 children, and he is 42 years old. Ikrom works at a gas station. Except for that he also is engaged in agriculture. He owns a piece of land on which he sows rice. Therefore he wants to receive a loan so that he can buy more seeds and fertilizer, because it is the time to plant crops. To achieve this he needs to receive a loan of 1,025 dollars and he plans to repay the loan within 18 months. Ikrom is a very hardworking and cheerful person.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Назаров Икром проживает в городе Турсун- заде. Женат и имеет пятерых детей. Возраст 42 года. Работает на заправке. Кроме того занимается земледелием. Имеет участок земли , который засеивает рисом. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить семена и удобрения, так как пришло время посева. Для этого необходимо получить 3500 сомони , сроком на 18 месяцев.Икром очень трудолюбивый и веселый человек.

loans.use: Purchase of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Teddy's Agape Group

texts.en:
Teddy is a married woman with a four-year-old child. She became a charcoal seller in 2005. Every day, she works from 9am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $US53 from her sales.

In the past, Teddy has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business.Teddy now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal inventory.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: This is the third time that Mrs. Neang K. S. has requested a loan . She is a farmer in Trapaing Skor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. York Yeth, is a pig breeder. Since his business is going well, he wants to sell his pigs door-to-door.  Because of his success, Mrs. Neang K. decided to ask for a loan to add to her current savings to buy a motorbike in order to transport his husband pigs to sell. Mrs. Neang K. is 37 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the remaining two are attending school. Previously, Mrs. Neang K. had obtained a loan to build a new house. She has succeeded in paying the loan off.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add to her saving to buy a motorbike in order to transport his husband pigs to sell.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: Emilio es agricultor, gracias a su empeño y dedicación a la agricultura puede brindar lo necesario a su pequeña hija.  Ahora se está dedicando al cultivo de maíz, prontamente  estará cosechando y nuevamente espera estar preparada para el cultivo de nuevos productos agrícolas, sin embargo para esto, requiere de mayor cantidad de abonos, para que sus plantas puedan desarrollarse adecuadamente y sus productos sean de calidad, para así venderlos a mejor precio en los mercados.Siendo así, Emilio solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para incrementar su producción y mejorar sus productos, los cuales ayudarán a la siembra de otros productos agrícolas.Emilio espera de usted para consolidar sus planes de producción.
texts.en:
Emilio is a farmer. Thanks to his hard work and dedication, his farm can earn enough to support his small daughter. Emilio is currently growing corn, but after the upcoming harvest he hopes to be prepared to grow new products. In order to do this, Emilio needs a larger quantity of fertilizers so that his crops can develop adequately. He hopes to grow high quality crops so that he can sell them for a better price in the markets. For this reason, Emilio is asking for a loan of 1000 soles to increase his production and improve his products, the sales from which will fund the planting for a new cycle of crops. Emilio hopes that you can consolidate his production plans.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase and improve agricultural production

loans.name: Ith

texts.en:
Mrs. Ith K. is a villager in Ang Tanuo village in Takeo Province. She is a hen and pig breeder. She faces some problems because her business is going well but it is nearly finished. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Ith K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy four pigs and one hundred hens for breeding to add to her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

Her husband, Mr. Sokorn Nang, is a construction worker. Mrs. Ith K. is a 29-year-old mother of four children who are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy four pigs and one hundred hens

loans.name: José Mercedes

texts.es:
El señor José F. es originario de la ciudad de Masaya dedicándose a atender su propia pulpería que a través de los años ha venido surtiendo ya que él tiene una visión de crecimiento y desarrollo en su negocio.

Por ser responsable de su hogar tiene el deber de mantener a su esposa e hijo y para ello debe de  brindarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo por lo que lo puede lograr solamente con el mejoramiento de su negocio. Es por esta razón que ha llegado a Ceprodel esperando que le sea otorgado el crédito para la compra de los productos y así mejorar su condición y la de su familia que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Mr. José F. is a native of the city of Masaya, and runs his own general store that, along the years, has been successful enough that he now has a vision of growth and development for his business. Because he is the head of household, he is responsible for supporting his wife and son, and for this reason he must provide them with the things they need to develop, which he can only do by improving his business. It is for this reason that he has come to Ceprodel, hoping to receive a loan to buy the merchandise he needs, so he can better his economic circumstances and those of his family, which he loves so much.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing goods to sell in his store

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the Glorioso Village Bank, one of FINCA Peru’s oldest village banks. Antonia is 42 years old and married with six children. Antonia buys sheep and pigs from the countryside and resells them in one of Ayacucho’s markets, mainly to distributors who then sell the animals to local restaurants. She has had this business for two and a half years now. She works every day of the week, and sells about 120 animals each week. 

Antonia is requesting a loan of 1050 soles, which she will use to buy ten sheep. Her goal for the future is to build her own home using the money from her FINCA savings account.

loans.use: Buy ten sheep

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhor P. is a villager in Toul Srolao village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Cheom Narann, are farmers who collect a little rice revenue to support the family. In order to provide a better life for the family, Mrs. Nhor P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a motor-taxi business.

She is 36 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest is just one year old. Her husband and children are presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to start motor taxi business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr:
Originaire d'ALLADA où dame A. vit le jour le 30 Décembre 1971. Elle s'est mariée à HOUENOU Théophile un peintre de formation. Elle est mère de deux enfants dont un garçon et une fille tous scolarisés. Elle exerce l'activité de la vente des glacières, des bassines en plastique, des tissus, des bazins riches, des pagnes et des chaussures. Elle va s'apprauvisionner à LOME et au GHANA. Actuellement, ses activités économiques sont très florissantes et le besoin de financement se fait sentir de plus en plus. C’est son quatrième prêt. 


La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé.
texts.en:
Ms. A. was born on December 30, 1971 in ALLADA, where her roots are. She is married to Théophile HOUENOU, a painter by training. And she is the mother of two children (a boy and a girl), who are both in school. Her work involves selling coolers (insulated containers), plastic tubs, shoes, and cloth -- rich damask fabrics and pagnes (colorful West African cloth). Her goods will be gotten in LOME and in GHANA. Currently, her commercial business is booming, and the need for financing is felt more and more. This is her fourth loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coolers, tubs, cloth, and shoes

loans.name: Makunguru Group

texts.en:
Rose has been a snack seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 6 years. She belongs to Makunguru group loan (Group code 2004).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $450. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Rose is 42 old, married, and has five children.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Edina, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en: Ebenezer A. sells an array of merchandise including cosmetics, rubbers, watches, and belts in Kissi near Elmin. He has been in this business since 2004. He is married, has three children, and has completed a senior high school education. His wife is employed as a trader. He is financially responsible for his children's school fees and for other bills for his family. The goal of the loan is to expand his business and create higher profits. He plans to reinvest the profits in his business for further growth.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria O. sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She is 49 years old and married with 5 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more foodstuffs, drinks and provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Mrs. Amelita B., a resident of Siari, Sindangan, Zamboanga Del Norte, is married and has a mini-grocery store located in their barangay. She started her business with only a small amount of capital and follows a system called "angkat-angkat of goods". It is like operating on a consignment basis.

As time goes by and with the help of Paglaum MPC, her business is doing well. It is becoming bigger and bigger. She is happy with what is happening in her life because she serves the needs of the people in a growing way. Mrs. B., with her husband's help, wants to expand and cater not only to their barangay but also to other barangays.

loans.use: Capital for her mini-grocery store

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Ортиков Баходур. Торгует мясом, колбасой и другими мясными изделиями. Товар привозит из Узбекистана , а также торгует местного производства. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2005 года.  Кредит получил на расширение ассортимента мясных изделий. Благодаря поддержки КИВА он расширил свой товар и бизнес . Планирует в будущем открыть еще одну точку в другом месте.
texts.en:
O. Bahodur sells meat, sausage, and other meat products. He imports goods from Uzbekistan and also sells local products. He has worked with MicroInvest since 2005. He has used his loan to expand his assortment of meat products. Thanks to Kiva, he has been able to expand his inventory and business. He plans to open another shop in the future.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand inventory

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco  se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). 
También  trabaja como veterinario en su comunidad, realizando inseminaciones, venta de medicinas espacialmente para ganado vacuno.
 
Vive. en la  localidad de Pucarani, de la Provincia los Andes del departamento de La Paz, ubicado  a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Su esposa trabaja en el cuidado del ganado y como ama de casa,  junto a sus hijos. 
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el tercer  crédito con Impro y segundo vía KIVA la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Francisco raises bovine cattle and sells their milk to the PIL Andina (Milk Industrializing Factory). He also works as a veterinarian in his community, carrying out immunizations, and selling medicines especially those for bovine cattle. He lives in Pucarani, in the Province of Los Andes, in the department of La Paz, located three hours from the city of La Paz. His wife works in the care of cattle and as homemaker in regards to their children. The loan will be used to purchase a milk cow and in that way increase milk production and their income. This is his third loan with Impro, and the second loan that is being channeled through Kiva; the evaluation carried out qualifies him to be approved for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mr. Kong D. and his wife are shown in the picture. Kong D. is 35. He owns a motorbike that he uses to provide a picking-up service to passengers;  he earns approximately $3 per day to meet his family’s daily living expenses. His wife works selling fresh fish in the local busy market. Kong D. will be using the Kiva loan to replace his old motorbike, which is not attractive. The rest of the loan will be used to buy a boat to fish in the Tunle Sap River, to earn additional income.

loans.use: To replace his old motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement and other construction supplies

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
With this loan of PHP25,000 loan from Kiva, Caroline hopes to able to improve her general store business and maintain her small eatery located in the village of Sili Aurora, Isabela, where her family is living happily. Caroline is already 49 years old, and her husband Joseph is already 54 years of age. They are blessed with four children: Jocelyn, Joseph, Jacquelyn, and Charles Andrew.

Caroline's business enable her to support her family, especially the expensess for her youngest son, who is now in his fourth year of high school in preparation for college. Caroline wishes to become successful in her business through hard work, patience, and continued assistance from Kiva loans. Caroline also believes that everything is possible if we commit to God.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Carmelle

texts.fr: Carmelle est née le 10 avril 1980 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Carmelle est célibataire sans enfants et vit à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Carmelle vend des tissus sur commande. En effet, Carmelle distribue à crédit des tissus à sa clientèle qui en fait la demande. Carmelle passe quelques jours après pour colleter ses fonds selon l’échéancier de paiement arrêté avec ses clients. C’est au Ghana, pays frontaliers au Bénin que Carmelle achète ses tissus. Carmelle a besoins de plus de moyens financiers qu’elle en possède actuellement pour répondre efficacement à la demande de sa clientèle. Alors, Carmelle sollicite le soutient financier de ALIDé pour mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Carmelle was born on April 10, 1980 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. She is unmarried and has no children. She lives in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Carmelle sells cloth by special order. Basically, she distributes cloth on credit to customers ordering from her. Later on, she comes around to collect, according to a payment schedule settled with her customers. Ghana, a nation near Benin, is where she buys her cloth. Carmelle needs more financing than she currently has for responding appropriately to customer demands. She is therefore requesting financial support from ALIDé to satisfy her customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two 12-meter bolts of WAX cloth and ten 12-meter bolts of HI-TARGET cloth

loans.name: Suati

texts.en:
Suati L. is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Sataoa. She is married and has 5 children school-aged children. To make a living, Suati owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting breadfruit for sale. Suati has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2006, Suati joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Suati has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment. Suati is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Suati plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam S. is 39 years old and resides with her husband and four of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She is a housewife living at home cooking for the family member. Her husband sells ice-cream and ice to earn a living and is able to make about US$6.5 of profit every day and is supported by two of the children who are blacksmith and a garment factory worker. Sam S. would like to take out a loan of US$600 for her husband to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the ice-cream's business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica B. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 44 years old. Veronica is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Veronica owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store where she sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Veronica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. She use the previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP that she will use to expand her business. This will be Veronica's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon T.'s main source of income comes from buying and selling fruits and vegetables in her community. Sharon is just starting this business. She is 24 years old, single and has three school-age children. She is from the village of San Isidro, Talakag, Bukidnon.

In 2009, Sharon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Sharon is requesting a loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dou's Group

texts.en:
There are four low-income people who have decided to request a loan, which they will use for a various purposes. Mrs. Dou Y., 53 years of age, has been selected to be the leader of the loan. She currently lives with her eight children and her husband, who stays at home to weave bamboo baskets to sell. To earn a living, Dou Y. has owned a small handicraft business as a bamboo basket weaver since 1980. She saves up over one hundred sets of baskets before she sells them. Dou Y. lacks raw materials for her business so she requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more bamboo to make baskets. The other borrowers are:
N., a basket seller, is applying for a loan to use as capital to buy more items to sell. 
S., who sells bamboo baskets that she buys in bulk from her wholesale supplier, asks for a loan to purchase more baskets to meet the needs of her customers.
S. will use her loan to purchase more raw materials to weave bamboo baskets.

loans.use: To purchase more bamboo to make baskets

loans.name: Tété Jeanne

texts.fr: G. Tété Jeanne est née le 13 Janvier 1981 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Tété Jeanne est mariée et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Tété Jeanne vit seule avec ses enfants au quartier Midombo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est depuis 8 ans que Tété Jeanne est dans ce quartier. Tété Jeanne supporte seule les charges de la famille. Tété Jeanne a arrêté très tôt l’école et a appris le métier de coiffure. En plus de ce métier, Tété Jeanne vend des mèches, des produits pour cheveux et des cartes de recharges dans son atelier de coiffure sise à Midombo. C’est depuis 6 ans que Tété Jeanne exerce cette activité. Tété Jeanne s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. C’est pour accroître la taille de son activité et augmenter sa clientèle que Tété Jeanne sollicite un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
G. Tété Jeanne was born on January 13, 1981 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin.  She is married and the mother of two children who are both in school.  She lives alone with her children in the Midombo district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She has been living in this district for eight years.  She alone provides for the family.  Very early on, Tété Jeanne stopped attending school and learned the trade of hairstyling.  In addition to this trade, she sells hair extensions, hair products, and mobile phone recharge cards in her salon near Midombo.  She has been in this business for six years.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans.  To grow her business and to increase her customer base, she's requesting a sixth loan from ALIDé. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and hairstyling products

loans.name: Akil

texts.en: Akil is 32 years old and has owned a painting shop in his town since 2006. His shop has a high level of demand thus he is requesting a loan of $1,200 so he can purchase a variety of paint cans to enlarge his shop in order to meet his clients' requirements and earn a good income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of paint cans

loans.name: Baatarsuren

texts.en: B. Baatarsuren is 33 years old and lives in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She lives with her husband in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Baatarsuren operates a small grocery trading business in her town. She started her business in 2006 with working capital of 50,000 tugrugs (~35 USD) and has built a consistent operation over the last two years. Today, she has a large customer base that appreciates her quality food products and her working capital now exceeds 400,000 tugrugs (~280 USD). She attributes this success to her good management and accounting skills. Baatarsuren hopes to continue her success in the future and says, “I hope to soon expand my business to increase my sales.” She is requesting a 380,000 tugrug (~270 USD) loan to purchase groceries for her shop.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to resell

loans.name: Asef

texts.en:
Asef is a 36-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa Valey with his wife and their three children. Asef has been working in construction since 1994. Asef requested a loan from A. Majmoua to purchase metA. for his work. This is his second loan and he has always repaid on time. 

Asef's business is speciA. because of his good and precise work. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition. He decided to start his business because he wanted to work independently and he had experience in this field.

loans.use: To purchase metal for his work.

loans.name: Sayeed Khalid

texts.en: Sayeed Khalid, son of S., lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and is an educated man. His father was a pilot in the army but, during the war in Afghanistan, he was injured. He left the army and Khalid then started a business by opening a retail shop that he is still running. Sayeed Khalid would like to expand his business so he wants an individual loan of 50000 Afghani to buy notebooks, biscuits, pens and pencils. He wants to increase his stock so that he can make a good income and help his family. He is happy that he can expand his business with this loan.

loans.use: He wants to buy more stock for his shop

loans.name: Pisey

texts.en:
Mrs. Pisey S. (pictured here), 24, and her husband, Mr. Chanthorn Phon, 28, married in 2003. They have two young daughters. They are living on an island of Mekong River roughly 15kms northeast of Phnom Penh City.

Pisey has been a silk weaver since she was 14. Also, she buys finished silk fabric from people in her village which she resells to a middleman. He then sells it in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has had a full-time job in Phnom Penh for 3 years. 

Pisey is applying for a loan of 800USD to purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to buy finished silk fabric for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and finished silk fabric for resale

loans.name: Inoyatullo

texts.ru: Нодиров Иноятулло проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 31 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Иноятулло не имеет высшего образования. Он более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно- рогатый скот у себя дома. В этом ему помогает жена. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Inoyatullo N. lives in the Yavan district. He is 31 years old, married and has 4 children. Inoyatullo does not have a higher education. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 5 years. He breeds cattle at home. His wife helps him with this business. Inoyatullo is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle in order to increase its quantity.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
ESTE CLIENTE ES AGRICULTOR Y GANADERO DE LA ZONA DE COSIGUINA MUNICIPIODE EL VIEJO 
ES UN HOMBRE CASADO DE FAMILANUMEROZA POR VIVIR EN LA ZONA MAS ALEJADA DE LA CIUDAD NO POSEE ENERGIA ELECTRICA EN SU CASA POR LO QUE ES CREDITO LO SOLICITA PARA LA COMPRA DE UN EQUIPO SOLAR Y ASI MEJORA EL ESTILO DE VIDA
texts.en:
This client is an agriculturer and a farmer in the Cosiguina distrcit of the Viejo municipality. He is a married man and he has a large family. They live in the farthest region of the city so they do not have electricity in their home. This loan is directed towards the purchase of a device to harness solar energy, so that their quality of life might be improved.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a solar panel to harness solar energy.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old. Elizabeth is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop which sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ndere Byara Group, Rukungiri

texts.en:
A determined and very ambitious K. Jovia, aged 54 years, is married with four children and two helpless dependents.

Jovia has operated a retail shop business for five years from Rwoya trading centre, Rukungiri District, and at the end of every month is able to fetch a profit of 120,000 Ugandan shillings. Her main drawback has been having a small amount of stock in her business that cannot match the consumption rate of her customers.

Therefore, Jovia is seeking a loan that can help her to stock more goods to satisfy her customers’ high demand and also to transform it into a wholesale business.

Being very committed to her business, with good customer care, Jovia hopes to increase her sales revenue. This will bring about a fundamental change in her business and enable her to achieve a self-sustaining life and cater for her family’s requirements.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Diodesa

texts.en:
Diodesa P. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old and married with two adult children. To make a living, Diodesa raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Diodesa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diodesa is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Diodesa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Sandra Patricia B. Rodríguez es una mujer muy creativa, fabrica  artesanías en madera Country, tejidos, lencería y  todo lo que se refiere a decoración. Ella es casada y madre de 4 pequeños entre los 4 y 10 años de edad, comenzó dictando clases en madera y pinceladas  a las que luego agregó bordado, lencería y decoración;  desde  hace 2 años inició su negocio de fabricar lo que elabora, esto ha dado muy buenos frutos y en la actualidad algunos productos son fabricados por los estudiantes del curso aprovechando toda su infraestructura y así puede ofrecer mejores precios a sus clientes. En la actualidad  solicita su primer crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo porque necesita comprar materias primas, especialmente madera y  también necesita dinero para mejorar la entrada de su local.  

Sandra Sueña con que su negocio siga creciendo, se convierta en una gran tienda de artesanías, donde las personas tengan la oportunidad de aprender técnicas especiales usadas en las manualidades y extenderse a muchas ciudades de Colombia, así generaría  mayores ingresos y su familia tendría mejores oportunidades, porque tiene el propósito de  brindarle una educación de calidad a sus hijos. Sus desafíos se hacen visibles en la época de  baja temporada porque se disminuyen las ventas, entonces ella debe ingeniárselas para impulsar sus productos. 

Sandra Patricia vive en un barrio  con una combinación especial que favorece la estructura de venta de su negocio, es muy comercial y al mismo tiempo residencial, goza de instalaciones seguras por eso se torna tranquilo y además tiene grandes almacenes y supermercados cercanos.
texts.en:
Sandra Patricia B. R. is a very creative woman. She operates a business selling craft products made from wood, textiles, linens, etc. She is married and the mother of 4 children who are between 4 and 10 years old. She began by offering classes in woodworking and painting and, later, embroidery and decoration, as well. She started a business making products from her designs 2 years. The business is now a success. Her students make craft products using her tools and supplies and she then sells the products on at an attractive price. Sandra is applying for a loan from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo because she needs to buy basic supplies, especially wood, and improve the entrance to her shop. Sandra hopes her business will continue to grow and ultimately become a large store selling traditional craft products, but also a place where people can come to learn to make traditional crafts. She would like to expand to other cities in Colombia, as well, so that she can increase her income and provide her family with opportunities that they wouldn't otherwise have. The challenges that she faces are most apparent during the low season when her sales fall and she has to apply all of her genius to press sales of her products. Sandra Patricia lives in a neighborhood with a good mix of businesses that support her type of business. It's very commercial and, at the same time, residential, quiet and safe, but also close to large stores and supermarkets.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for crafts business.

loans.name: Luna Radiante Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal, Panamericana se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal Luna Radiante. Se agruparon por la necesidad de contar con un capital que les permita mejorar sus negocios.
Las integrantes de esta Asociación tienen variados negocios del área de producción, servicio y comercio. 
Un ejemplo claro es María René A. Gpmzales de 27 años, ingresó al grupo a trávés  de su mamá quien ya pertenecía a la Asociación. Maria se dedica a vender ropa deportiva hace 10 años con el apoyo y enseñanza de su madre, con el crédito que esta solicitando tiene planificado comprar busos, chamarras y poleras para porteriormente venderlos en la feria 16 de Julio. María tiene que combinar la adminsitración de su negocio con el cuidado de sus 4 hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Luna Radiante” meets every two weeks in the Regional Office, Panamericana. They formed a group because of their need for capital that would allow them to improve their businesses. The members of this Association have different businesses in the areas of production, services and shop keeping. A clear example is María René A. G. who is 27 years old. She joined the group though her mom who already belonged to the Association. María has worked selling sports clothing for 10 years with the support and guidance of her mother. She plans to buy sweatshirts, jackets and t-shirts with the loan she is applying for and later sell them at the July 16th fair. María has to combine running her business with caring for her 4 children.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine J., 44, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Johnimar J., a goldsmith, they are blessed in their marriage. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own gold jewelry business while also doing direct selling and retailing of electronic cellular phone load.

Josephine has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times through CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 31,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by allowing her to buy more products to be incorporated into her current inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products to add to her inventory

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia es casada con hijos y viven en casa propia en la zona Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Julia vende comida; esta actividad produce ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para comprar sus insumos por cantidad y así poder bajar sus costos y a la vez tener mas ingresos para su familia.
Esta es la tercera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Julia is married and has children. They live in their own house in the Tacagua area of the city of La Paz. Julia sells food. This activity produces income for her home. The requested loan is to buy her supplies in quantities to be able to reduce the costs. At the same time, she will have more income for her family. This is the third time she has requested a loan. The completed socioeconomic evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies in bulk for her food preparation business

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es: El Señor  Froilán es un cliente nuevo,  ha mostrando buena voluntad de pago y un trato amable y Cortez en la evaluación que se le hizo,  por esta razón se lo escogió para otorgarle el crédito kiva.  El cliente cuenta con un snack (cafetería - pastelería), que esta ubicado en la zona de la 16 de julio av. Juan pablo II, empieza su labor a las 9:00 am y la termina a las 21:00 aproximada mente, la esposa es quien prepara los pasteles, tortas y empanadas, el negocio es familiar ya que la hija mayor también ayuda en la atención (por las tardes). El mayor sueño de la familia es llegar a tener un buen patrimonio estable y que sus hijos lleguen a tener una carrera profesional, por lo que se esfuerzan en lograrlo día a día.
texts.en:
Froilán is a new client. He has demonstrated the willingness to pay, and he was friendly and polite during the evaluation. That is why he was selected for a Kiva loan. He has a snack business (cafeteria – bakery), which is located in the area of 16 de Julio avenue and Juan Pablo II. He starts his work at 9:00 a.m. and finishes at approximately 9:00 p.m. His wife makes the pastries, cakes, and empanadas. It is a family business. His daughter helps wait on customers (in the afternoons). The families’ greatest dream is to have a good, stable financial situation, and that the children come to have a professional career. They work very hard everyday to achieve their dream.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair equipment and fix up snack stand

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora M. is 55 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. She is from the village of Allinguigan 3rd, a part of Ilagan municipality in the province of Isabela on the Luzon islands. Flora makes a living by providing motorcycle transportation to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2000 PHP.

In 2009, Flora joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid her most recent loan of 9000 PHP from ASKI. Flora is requesting a new loan, her third from ASKI, of 6000 PHP that will be used to maintain her business. She plans to use all additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To maintain her transportation business

loans.name: Tserendulam

texts.en:
Ms. Tserendulam, 37, is single mother and lives with her three boys in her elder brother's house in Ulaanbaatar city. She used to work for the Temuujin Mench clothing factory as a tailor until the factory was shut down.

In 2004, she bought two sewing machines and started her own tailoring business. Now she has six sewing machines, employs two tailors and sells her products to three different companies by contract. Her current assets are 870,000 Mongolian tugriks. 

Recently, she bought a piece of land but has no house on it. Therefore, she and her children live temporarily in her brother's house. She is a very hardworking woman with a strong will. Her eldest son Baasanbat dreams to become a mathematician. 

She is planning to extend her business and profits and therefore improve her lifestyle and give her children a good education. She is planning to use this loan for her business extension, increasing her current assets and buying some fabric and materials for her tailoring business.

loans.use: Increasing her current assets and buying some fabric and materials

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen B. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Helen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Helen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo es un padre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos menores hijos en el distrito de Jequetepeque, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, especialmente aves de corral, el cría patos, pavos y gallinas en la parte posterior de su domicilio y las alimenta de granos, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona. Esta actividad es la unica que le genera ingresos por lo que siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si para mantenerse el rubro.

Arturo desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de alimento balanceado para lograr que sus animales se desarrollen de mejor manera y sean vendidos a mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona bastante responsable y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su familia la oportunidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida. En la foto sale con un toro que no es suyo.
texts.en:
Arturo, 31, is a father living with his wife and two minor children in Jequetepeque district, a farming area in Pacasmayo province, La Libertad region, located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. He raises small farm animals, especially barnyard fowl. He raises ducks, turkeys and chickens in his back yard. He feeds them grains and when they reach a good level of development he sells them to area merchants. This activity is his only source of income so he always gives the best of himself to stay in business. Arturo would like to expand his business buying nutritionally balanced feed so that his animals will develop better and command a higher sales price. To reach this goal he has had the need to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 new soles. He is quite a responsible, hard working person. His greatest wish is to provide his family with the opportunity to have a better quality of life. He is pictured with a bull that does not belong to him.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small farm animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 62 year old man living in Tyre with his wife.  He has worked in selling electrical appliances and sanitary wares since 2007. This is the first time Jihad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua, and it is for increasing his stock in order to increase his income and support his business.

Jihad believes that this loan will improve his living situation and help his family. His good reputation helped a lot in increasing his clients since most of them are relatives, neighbors, friends, and friends of friends. He has experience in this field and hopes to improve and expand his field of work as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy more products

loans.name: Encanto Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento ENCANTO esta compuesto por la siguiente mesa directiva: la presidenta del grupo  es la señora Gregoria, se dedica a la venta de comidas y bebidas, desde hace 6 años, su familia esta compuesta de su esposo y nueve hijos de los cuales cinco ya son casados y cuatro viven con ella de los cuales siguen estudiando. El monto que solicito es para comprar  de refrescos.  
El tesorero del grupo es don Cristian, se dedica al transporte en la línea de taxi trufi  hace 4 años, su familia esta compuesta por su esposa y su hijo que tiene un año de edad.  El monto que ha solicitado es para la compra de algunos repuestos para su movilidad. 
La secretaria del grupo es la Sra. Jiovana, que se dedica a la venta de comidas en su domicilio desde hace 2 años, su familia esta compuesta por su esposo y sus tres hijos que dos de ellos estudian y una es bebe todavía. El monto que solicito es para la compra de una cocinilla que arde más fuerte y con más hornallas.
Todas las socias del Banco Encanto son personas trabajadoras y muy responsables con muchas ganas de superación.En la fotoa estan 11 personas ya que dos de las socias vinieron acompañadas.
texts.en:
The Encanto communal bank is comprised of the following board of directors: The president of the group is Gregoria, who has worked selling food and drinks for six years. Her family consists of her husband and nine children, five of which are already married and four of them live with her and continue in school. The loan requested is to purchase refreshments.

The treasurer of the group is Cristian who has worked in transportation with a trufi (a taxi that travels along a specific route and has fixed stops) for four years. His family consists of his wife and 1-year-old son. The loan that he has requested is for the purchase of some spare parts for his vehicle.

The secretary of the group is Jiovana and she has worked selling food from her home for two years. Her family consists of her husband and three children, two of which are in school and one is still a baby. The loan she has requested is for the purchase of a stove that burns stronger and has more burners.

All of the members of the Encanto communal bank are hardworking and very responsible people with a lot of desire to overcome. There are 11 people in the photo because two of the members came with someone.

loans.use: To purchase refreshments and a stove

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
"Lily D. C. is a 51-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: hog raising and general store businesses.  She lives in Prk. Bloomington, Brgy. Candau-ay, Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  By working hard in her hog raising and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now eans an average income of PHP 8,000. Lily is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can continue to purchase feeds for her piggery and stocks for the general store.   This will be her 4th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Lily aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 


About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase feeds for the Piggery and Stocks for General Store

loans.name: Sean

texts.en: Sean T. has spent her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has four children, and most of them are not enrolled in school yet, because they are so young. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Sean T. is able to plant crops at least twice a year. She is able to plant crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Because her farm is outside of a watering system, Sean T. would like a loan to buy a pumping machine for irrigation. She proposes to use the remainder of loan to do a dry-season rice-field.

loans.use: To buy a pumping machine for irrigation, and to do a dry-season rice-field.

loans.name: Kikompii Ole

texts.en:
Kikompii Ole S. is 33 years old. He is married to Timanoi Ene Sinkayo and is a father of three school-going children. 

Kikompii is a farmer and does the farming on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last ten years.

He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his second loan, which he plans to use on his farm to prepare it and buy farm supplies. The farm, being located along the main road, makes it easy for him to get customers for his maize.  With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm to increase his maize production.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where he can plant more maize for commercial purpose.

Kikompii is a hardworking man and is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To prepare land and buy farm supplies

loans.name: Gabin

texts.en:
Gabin is 26 years old and is still single. He has been selling soft drinks for two years. His business is open from early in the morning, 8 am, until late in the evening, 11pm, every day. He currently employs 6 people in his business.

Gabin will use this loan to purchase soft drinks and local beer, which are very popular.  As a young entrepreneur he plans to use any profit made to reinvest and grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and beer to sell

loans.name: Vilma Guadalupe

texts.es:
Vilma, tiene 35 años de edad, se dedica a vender tortillas, reside en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután, donde vive con su hija y su esposo, el negocio lo inicio con su madre, desde que tenía 10 años  de edad, hoy día su horario de trabajo es de 6:00am a 5:00pm, en el mercado municipal.
Vilma necesita de material para tener almacenado y solicita un préstamo para realizar dicha compra que será en maíz, leña y gas propano, con esta inversión mantendrá un buen nivel de materia prima existente para dar salida a la venta de tortillas y aumentar la producción.
Sus aspiraciones es tener un negocio estable, con muchos clientes, y generar para su familia ingresos.
texts.en:
Vilma is 35 years old and her business is selling tortillas.  She lives in Jucuapa, in Usulután department, with her husband and daughter.  She started her business with her mother when she was 10 years old.  Her current work day is from 6.00am to 5.00pm.  She works in the town market.

Vilma needs to have a supply of materials in stock and she is requesting a loan to buy corn, firewood and propane gas.  This investment will allow her to maintain a good level of raw materials on hand for her tortilla business and to increase her production.  Her goal is to have a stable business with a lot of customers and to make income for her family.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood and propane gas

loans.name: Jorge Sergio

texts.es: El Sr. Jorge  es una persona muy trabajadora, se dedica al servicio de transporte como taxista. Él vive en la zona valle de las flores que se encuentra a treinta minutos del centro de la cuidad, don Jorge es un poco solitario ya que sus familiares e hijos viven en otros países. Pero a pesar de esto él continua trabajando para poder comprar una casa propia. Don Jorge trabaja mucho tiempo con nuestra institución y en este tiempo demostró ser una persona puntual y responsable, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la refacción de su movilidad y la compra de llantas. Una de las amistades mas cercanas que tiene es su vecina, doña margarita, quien vive en la casa de en frente, ella es una persona mayor de edad que se dedica a la elaboración de mantas. Don Jorge cuenta que debido a su actividad él llega a conocer a muchas personas diariamente y estas personas frecuentemente son muy amables ya que él demuestra ser también una persona respetuosa y amable.
texts.en:
Jorge is a very hard-working person.  He is a taxi driver.  He lives in the Valle de las Flores zone, which is thirty minutes from the center of the city.  Jorge is a bit lonely because his relatives and children live in other countries.

In spite of this, he continues working to be able to buy his own house.  Jorge has worked with our institution for a long time.  In that time he has shown himself to be a punctual and responsible person.  He will use the loan to refurbish his vehicle and to buy tires.

One of his closest friends, Margarita, lives in the house in front of him.  She is elderly, and she makes blankets.

Jorge says that due to his business activity he comes to know a lot of people every day.  These people are frequently very friendly because he is also a respectful and friendly person.

loans.use: To buy tires and perfom maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Eunice Muyoka

texts.en:
Eunice Muyoka K. is 36 years old.  She is married and is a mother of four children.  They live in Kitale town, where Eunice sells cattle to make a living.   She has been in this business for two years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 shillings.

This will be Eunices' first loan from KADET LTD, which she wants to use to buy two cows to add to her herd of cows.  With the income that she will get, she will buy more cows for resale. 

In the future, she wants to educate her children to the highest level and buy a plot of land and build a house of her own.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Shernalyn

texts.en:
Shernalyn is a 39-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: food vending and frozen foods. She lives in Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending and frozen foods businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Shernalyn is borrowing PHP 19,000 to fund operations. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Shernalyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Fayad

texts.en:
Fayad is 19 years old, a single man from Bint Jbeil, owner of a barber shop since 2002. Fayad is a hard-working man; he loves his work and hopes to improve it. 

Fayad is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua, in order to  make necessary changes in his shop's decoration and machines. Most of his clients are his friends, relatives and neighbors. They enjoy coming to his shop because they meet each other there and have fun, which attracts more guys to join them and have a hair cut. Fayad's family encourages him a lot because he's good at what he is doing.

loans.use: To make necessary changes in his shop's decoration and machines

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a single mother with three children, all of whom graduated from school and are employed. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a vegetable stall for the past four years, selling from home to her neighboring community. Mwanajuma faces a major challenge of seasonality during the months of January to May when the number of customers in her food stall is low, while over the holiday season the number of customers is high. She dreams of building a permanent stall in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes. Mwanajuma decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Zoila Rita

texts.es:
Zoila de 54 años, es una mujer trabajadora que comenzó su actividad haciendo confecciones de ropa a sus clientes para así tener sus ganancias.

Ahora ella trabaja sola confeccionando ropa y cortinas o los que sus clientes le pidan. Lo que le afectad en su trabajo es la delincuencia que existe por su sector. Es soltera tiene tres hijos que son profesionales. Con el préstamo quiere adecuar su vivienda para así tener una vida tranquila y seguir en su negocio de confecciones.
texts.en:
Zoila is 54 years old; she is a hardworking woman that began working making clothing for her customers in order to get income.

Zoila works alone making clothing and curtains or whatever her customers want. A problem that she faces in her work is the delinquency that exists in her area. She is single and has 3 children that are professionals. With the loan she wants to fix her home so that she can have a calm life and to keep working as a seamstress.

loans.use: fix her home.

loans.name: Sol Radiante De Huaycan Group

texts.es: La Sra. Mercy  es conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar, Mercy  es integrante de la alcancía comunal “Sol Radiante de Huaycan” grupo conformado por 9 socios que se dedican a actividades de comercio, Mercy  trabaja en su propia librería donde vende lápiz, cuadernos, papel, utiles de escritorio,  desde hace un año, este trabajo surge a raíz de ella quería darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y a su vez conseguir mejores ingresos ya que  su pareja gana sueldo mínimo.  Mercy  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación  se ha comprado artefactos   y su hijo estudia en un colegio privado. El préstamo que  se le otorgo fue para comprar mercadería  para implementar su negocio. Sabemos que Mercy  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo la ayudaran.
texts.en:
Mercy lives with her partner and has one school-age child.  She is a member of the 'Sol Radiante de Huaycan' (Brilliant Sun of Huaycan) community bank.  This group has nine members who all work in commerce.  Mercy works in her own stationery store where she sells pencils, exercise books, paper and office supplies.  She has been in this business for one year.  She started her business because she wanted to provide a better quality of life for her son and also make better income because her partner earns minimum wage.

Thanks to her effort and commitment, Mercy has been able to buy small appliances and her son studies in a private school.  She was granted a loan to buy merchandise to stock her business.  We know that Mercy will accomplish her goals with a lot of work and effort and that Edaprospo's loans will help her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 26 years old, she has four children who are ages five to seven years; twho of them are adopted. Her husband sells different merchandise.

Odette owns a shop in which she sells soap, flour, rice and salt. She has done this business for 10 years and it has enabled her meet her family's needs. Odette needs a loan to buy more items such as rice, salt, flour etc. in order to make more profits. With the profits she plans to save up.

loans.use: to buy more items such as rice, salt, flour etc.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, es comerciante de ropa, junto a su familia conformada por cuatro hijos de 19, 23, 29 y 31 años de edad, todos están solteros y trabajan, ella comercializa la ropa y productos de belleza.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa: interior, blusas, faldas y productos de belleza, esmaltes, bases, maquillaje, lápiz labial, esta inversión le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y generar mejores ganancias.
El objetivo que tiene es comprar un lote para construir una casa propia donde vivir con sus hijos.
texts.en:
María's business is selling clothes and she lives with her family.  She has four children aged 19, 23, 29 and 31.  They are all single and they all work.  María sells clothes and beauty products.

María is requesting a loan to buy clothes (underwear, blouses and skirts) and beauty products (nail polish, foundation, make-up and lipsticks).  This investment will help her to strengthen her business and make better profits.

María's goal is to buy a plot of land so that she can build her own home and live in it with her children.

loans.use: to buy underwear, blouses, skirts and beauty products.

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en:
Marie Grace is a 30-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur who owns a general store that sells rice, sugar, and beans. The store has been running for 2.5 years and with the profits she has been able to buy cattle and a piece of land. 

Marie Grace is married and runs the store with her husband. Together they have two children that are two years and three months old. 

This loan will provide Marie Grace with the capital she needs to continue to buy rice and macrones (pasta) that she sells in the store. 

She will use the profits from her business to buy more animals for rearing and increase the stability and quality of life of her family.

loans.use: To buy rice and macrones to sell in her store.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Roselyn has a shop that sells canned goods, biscuits, breads & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Roselyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Roselyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer esforzada, que ha venido apoyando a su familia laborando y teniendo una pequeña pulperia, logrando asi ayudarse economicamente con los gastos. Su esposo labora como conductor y su pequeño hijo cursa la primaria.
Hoy en dia Martha solo esta laborando, ya que esta tiempo completo en el trabajo y no habia quien le atendiera su pulperia. Ya que anteriormente solo trabajaba medio tiempo.
Atraves de Afodenic ha mejorado su vivienda, pagando a plazo favorable, con el credito anterior logro la compra de un inodoro, metiendo aguas negras teniendo mejor higiene. Hoy en dia lograra poner piso y la compra del lavamanos. Sus planes a corto plazo es poner nuevamente su pulperia ya que le era rentable.
texts.en:
Martha is a hard-working woman. She has helped her family by working and starting a corner store. This has enabled to cover her expenses. Her husband works as a driver and her young son is in elementary school.

Currently, there is no one to run the corner store because Martha is working full time at her job. Previously she had only worked part-time at her job.

Through Afodenic she has improved her home, paying within a favorable time frame. With the prior loan she was able to purchase a toilet, is now able to dispose of sewage, and has better hygiene. Now she will be able to put in a floor and purchase a sink. 

Her short term plans are to reopen her corner store as it was profitable for her.

loans.use: to put in a new floor and purchase a sink.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.es: Áurea tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de LLochegua. Desde hace más de 4 años se dedica al negocio de artículos para fiestas y eventos. En un inicio empezó vendiendo con algunos productos básicos para dichos eventos tradicionales como bautizos, matrimonios y cumpleaños. Con el tiempo  logró implementarse de más mercadería  y eso le ha dado mayor ventaja y ganar más dinero, que lo deriva para los gastos de su familia. Actualmente ha extendido el servicio por el cual también tiene demanda en las graduaciones de universidades e institutos. El plan de Áurea, es la de implementar y renovar sus productos, por lo que espera realizar buenas ventas más que el año anterior. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por tal espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para que pueda mejorar su negocio. Con los 3.000 soles que solicita, comprará más artículos para fiestas y eventos, para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Áurea is 28 years old.  She is a single mother with two children.  They live together in their own home, located in the LLochegua district.  For more than 4 years, she has owned a business that provides supplies for parties and events.  She initially started selling basic products for traditional events such as baptisms, weddings, and birthdays.  Eventually, she offered additional merchandise and that has given her a greater advantage and enabled her to earn more money to pay her family’s expenses.  

Currently, she is extending the service to include graduations from universities and institutions as she also has demand in these markets. Áurea’s plan is to develop and renew her products and she hopes to earn better sales than the previous year.  This will be her first loan with MFP and she hopes for the support of each one of you in order to improve her business.  With the 3,000 soles that she is requesting, she will purchase more supplies for parties and events to operate her business.

loans.use: to purchase more party supplies.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent for her house.

For the past seven years, she has owned a preparatory school, teaching children from community. She faces a major challenge in her business when parents of students she teaches delay paying school fees. She dreams of expanding her school and equipping it with enough teaching materials to incorporate upper classes in the future.

With the 80,000 Kenyan shillings from this loan, Linda wants to purchase sand and cement to renovate her school, and buy stationery. She decided to join Kiva field partner Yehu in order to access loans with the hope of boosting her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand and cement to renovate her school, and stationery

loans.name: Cecilia  Indalecia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia se dedica a la  venta de antojitos  mexicanos estudio hasta tercer grado de la primaria , tiene un total de cuatro hijos dos mujeres y dos varones, desde hace tres años se ha dedicado a vender antojitos en las noches.
Doña Cecilia es una señora muy trabajadora a parte de vender antojitos mexicanos, se dedica a la venta de calzado por catalogo, le gusta tener sus propio negocio por que así ayuda a su esposo en los gastos de la casa y a sus hijos en sus estudios.
Sus clientes le recomiendan  que ponga un local mas grande por que cuando van a  cenar están muy apretados, ella pidió el préstamo para  hacer mas grande su local y sus clientes se sientan a gusto ya que van todos los días a cenar y se merecen estar comodos.
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado  para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Cecilia sells Mexican fast food snacks.  She went up to third grade.  She has a total of four children: two girls and two boys.  She’s sold fast food at night for the last three years.

Cecilia is a very hardworking woman.  Aside from selling Mexican fast food snacks she also sells shoes via catalogue.  She likes having her own business because she helps her husband cover household expenses and her children with their schooling that way.

Her customers have recommended that she enlarge her locale because when they go to have dinner they are too crowded.  She requested the loan to enlarge the locale so that her customers will be comfortable since they come every day to have dinner and they deserve to be comfortable.

She thanks the foundation for the support it’s given her to get ahead and make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to enlarge her food stand.

loans.name: Norilyn

texts.en:
Norilyn, 32 years old, is married and has three children. She lives in Calalinan, Siquijor, Siquijor.

Norilyn has operated a general store for 6 years. She earns a monthly income of PHP 6,000 from the store. Norilyn has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Norilyn is a newly recognized member of Pagalum Multi Purpose Cooperative as of July 12, 2011. She hopes to alleviate her family's poverty with the help of Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Khar  Ndiaye
