texts.fr: L'emprunteur est une femme divorcée qui vit avec ses deux enfants.Elle tient un restaurant au bord de la route nationale qui traverse son village.Elle propose à ses clients des plats plats à base de produits locaux.En plus, elle vend des melons qu'elle achète auprès d'un exploitant agricole installé à un kilomètre du village.Elle arrive à se prendre en charge et à entretenir ses deux enfants avec les bénéfices tirés de son commerce.Elle sollicite de l'UIMCEC un prêt de 150 000F pour acheter de l'huile, de l'oignon, du haricot et d'autres produits divers.Son ambition est d'agrandir son restaurant.
texts.en:
This borrower is a divorced woman who lives with her two children. She runs a restaurant by the main road that goes through her village, and her dishes are based on local products. She also sells melons, which she buys from a farmer located one kilometer from the village. She manages to support herself and her children with the profits earned from her business activities. 

She is seeking a loan of 150,000 F from the UIMCEC to buy oil, onions, beans and various other items. Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy oil, onions, beans and various other products for her restaurant

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
According to Asteria, " Hard work is the only way to overcome poverty". This is her inspiring principle in life. She is a mother who is now 47 years old and has four school-aged children. They have owned and managed a rice farm in their village for almost 27 years now. They endure hardships and difficulties in life for they want to educate their children and give them a better life.

They want to ask for additional capital of P20,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and to pay for other expenses in planting rice. She mentioned that they need to work hard and strive harder to increase their yields this coming harvest season. She is hoping that, some day, all of their children will earn a degree and that their standard of living will improve.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and pay for other rice planting expenses

loans.name: Yovanna

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO DE POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yovanna; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de animales menores como cuyes, chanchos y gallinas, ella vende en forma ambulatoria y también lleva a diferentes mercados, la socia los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de animales menores. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes, chanchos y gallinas y también para comprar alimentos para los animales.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yovanna belongs to the "Tres de Mayo de Poroy" communal bank, located in the Cusco district, which is part of Cusco province and department.  Yovanna is 28, in a  common-law relationship, and has one child.  

She alternates her daily chores with the buying and selling of smaller animals such as guinea pigs, pigs, chickens.  She sells door-to-door, and also carries on her business at different markets. She raises and fattens the animals and then sells them. By means of this business, she is helping her family get ahead in life. She wants to expand and improve her business of selling smaller animals.

She is applying for the loan in order to buy guinea pigs, pigs and chickens and also to buy feed for the animals. She is happy to receive the loan, and is committed to making her instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs, pigs, chickens, and animal feed.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 54 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a business buying and selling firewood and charcoal in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of firewood and charcoal to sell. Lolita has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her firewood and charcoal business for 15 years and also earns an income from selling bananas and vegetables. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Macilinda

texts.en: Macilinda is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has six children. Macilinda has been selling fish for 10 years. Macilinda sells fresh and dried fish to her community. She earns about 4000 PHP per month with her business. Macilinda plans to use her loan to buy more fish to sell. She hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 28 years old. He is married and a father of one child. He is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last six years.

He learned about KADET LTD through a registered client. He has been a good client and this will be his first loan which he is planning to spend to purchase agricultural inputs, i.e., maize seeds, fertilizers and also hire manpower to  aid him on the farm. 

He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming. His dream is do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Kristine Mae

texts.en: Kristine Mae is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Kristine Mae has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Kristine Mae hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.ru:
Сусанна родилась в Грузии в 1958. Сейчас она живет в Армении, в деревне Ачаджур, Тавушского региона. Она замужем и у нее есть сын, который живет отдельно и в скором времени собирается жениться. Муж Сусанны пенсионер. Сама Сусанна преподает и параллельно занимается растениеводством. 
Вместе с мужем у них есть небольшой виноградник и сад, в котором они выращивают сливы, яблоки и корольки. В основном они используют полученную продукцию для нужд своей собственной семьи, но, когда выдаются особо урожайные года, они продают часть своей продукции. Для увеличения дохода своей семьи, Сусанна и ее муж хотят начать выращивать фрукты на продажу, и для этой цели им необходим кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм. С помощью кредита они смогут огородить участок для сада и приобрести саженцы корольковых и инжирных деревьев.
texts.en: Susanna was born in Georgia in 1958 and currently lives in Armenia, in the Achadjur village of the Tavush region.  She is married and has a son, who lives separately and plans to get married soon.  Susanna's husband is a retiree.  Susanna teaches and parallel to that is involved in gardening.  Her husband and she have a small vineyard and garden, where they grow plums, apples and persimmons.  They primarily use their harvest to satisfy their own family needs, but when the harvest is especially rich, they sell part of their product.  In order to increase their family income, Susanna and her husband want to start growing fruits for sale and need a loan in the sum of 1,000,000 dram for this purpose.  They will able to use the loan to fence off a plot of land for a garden and buy persimmon and fig trees.

loans.use: to fence off garden and to buy persimmon and fig trees

loans.name: Desiderio

texts.en:
Desiderio pours out all his strength on his farm to make it profitable every harvest season. He had been raising crops on his 1.5-hectare rice field for almost 20 years and earns P30,000 every six months. According to him, it is just enough to pay for tuition fees for his four children. Two of them are in college while the rest are getting their high school education.

Desiderio aims to improve his corn production to provide for all their needs so he is asking for a loan of P45,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides. 

In the future, Desiderio would like to have good finances and enable his family to live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for farming.

loans.name: Tseko

texts.en:
Tseko, 49, is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rental bills.

For the past three years, he has operated a hawking business, moving from door to door to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, he wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita described herself as a patient and loving woman. With her love for her family, she works hard just to feed her children. She is always praying for the good health of her family and always has a happy family even when there are obstacles they encountered in life.
Perlita is 43 years of age, married and blessed with two children who are in school. Perlita manages a rice farming business within her village. Perlita and her husband are working together to give a better way of living for her children. They are preparing for their children's college education. She wishes to see her children become professionals someday.
With regards to her business, Perlita is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy seeds of rice, fertilizers and herbicides to used in the rice farming business. She will do her best to attain her wish.

loans.use: to buy seeds of rice, fertilizers and herbicides to be used in the rice farming business.

loans.name: Keila Ibeth

texts.es:
La señora Keila Ibeth es una señora trabajadora  que se dedica a la venta de  zapatos de la marca  Andrea, flexy y mega chau.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Alfonso quien  le ayuda y apoya en lo que desea ya que  tiene una hija pequeña que don Alfonso cuida cuando doña Keila va entregar sus pedidos de calzado.
Tambien se dedica a la siembra de palmas de papaya para la venta.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas calzado para la venta  ya que , su negocio le deja  buenas ganancias.
Le da las gracias a fundación por apoyarla cuando más lo necesitaba.
texts.en:
Keila Ibeth is a hardworking woman who has a business selling shoes in the brands Andrea, Flexy and Mega Chau.

She is happily married to Alfonso, who helps and supports her as needed, since they have a small daughter who Alfonso cares for when Keila goes out to deliver her shoe orders.

Keila also works cultivating papaya to sell.  She requested a loan so that she could buy more shoes to sell, because she is getting good earnings from her business. She thanks the Fundación for supporting her when she needed it the most.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en:
Nelie is 53 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Nelie has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from rice retailing. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg is 42 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in the city's outer district. Her husband works as a guard in a local shop.

Narantsetseg supports her family by running a shop that sells books and magazines in the town's largest indoor market. When she first began her business in 2003, she had 2,000,000 tugriks (MNT) in working capital. Now she has 12,500,000 MNT and sells pre-paid phone cards as well as books, magazines, and newspapers. 

Narantsetseg is requesting her fourth loan from Transcapital Co. Ltd. for 4,200,000 MNT, which she will use to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal for next year is to improve her business by expanding her stall and increasing her working capital, which will help her attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her bookstore.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her family. Kiva lenders! Meet Virginia, one of the most hardworking women on planet earth. She is 47 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. She hails from Mathira, a remote village in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. Virginia has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past ten years. 

Her primary sources of income are crops,vegetables,maize and animal farming. Virginia is content with the farming way of life. Virginia is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal education or formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her family of a decent meal. The Mathira area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to buy seeds and increase her horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Being a smallholder farmer and accessing funds in Kerugoya is very challenging, but Virginia feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising smallholder women like her. 

Virginia is well disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her family. Please help Virginia so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: To increase her horticulture farming and provide a better income for her family

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en: Lerma makes good earning on her farming activities in Lerma. This is how she supports her family and able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield especially that she has high cost of living when her children entered college. Lerma approached Paglaum to loan an amount to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Juana Alicia

texts.en:
Juanita lived through a difficult divorce some years ago, and she was left pennyless with three children, still underage, whom she needed to support on her own. She could not find a job so she started a business, the sale of used clothing. In this manner she was able to obtain the income to cover the necessities of her children and at the same time care for them while working out of her home.

It has not been easy to struggle on her own to put kids first. She now needs a loan of $250 to be able to purchase merchandise and increase her earnings. You can contribute and help secure the well being of Juanita and her children. You only need to make your decision and help them. Remember that they need you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Juanita hace algunos años que vivió un difícil divorcio, y quedó desamparada con tres hijos, aún menores de edad, a quienes tenía que sacar adelante ella sola, por lo que tenía que comenzara trabajar, pero no encontró trabajó, así que inició una actividad, la venta de ropa usada. De está forma logró obtener los ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos y al mismo tiempo poder cuidarlos al laborar en su propio domicilio.

Luchar sola para salir adelante con sus hijos no ha sido una tarea fácil, ahora ella requiere de un préstamo de $250 DLLS para poder comprar mercancía e incrementar sus ingresos. Tu puedes contribuir a asegurar el bienestar de Juanita y sus hijos, sólo hace falta que te decidas y los apoyes, recuerda que ellos te necesitan.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Gujet Kor

texts.en:
Gujet Kor is Indian-Afghan and lives in district 2 of Kabul, Afghanistan, in a household of 5. She has a patchwork and net business.

She says: 'During the war I was in Kabul and I learned how to do the trade from my neighbours because at that time there was no other work than these traditional things. Now I'm happy with my business, I can sew one carpet in 45 days and from that I can cover my financial problems and assist my family financially. I took a loan to buy more materials for my business - I always try to produce new designs and the best quality in the bazaar.

loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Joseph Ngwa

texts.en:
Joseph is married with eight children. A fire disaster consumed everything they had but for their lives and their pigs which were stolen by criminals shortly after the fire incident. Joseph took his first loan in 2004 and succeeded in providing his community with firewood and fresh raw food while dealing with his loss.

Joseph has gained self-esteem and  training in marketing techniques, credit management, and experience in the utilization and repayment of previous loans, and available support from group and center members. Given a loan of $600, he plans to buy a truck of wood, 4-piglets and 600Kg of feed for the pigs. He will continue to supply firewood which is the main source of energy for cooking, manure and fresh food to his community. He plans to repay the loan during the term.

loans.use: Sale of firewood and rearing of pigs.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Business Description

Carmen began her business four years ago. She sells clothing for children such as pants, blouses, costume jewelry, matched sets and underclothes. She offers her clients personalized service and attention, every day from 9 until 6.

Loan Use

Carmen needs this loan to invest in more clothing and new styles, as well as buy fabrics to produce the matching outfits she makes for children. In this way she will be able to offer new variety to her clients.

Personal Information

Carmen is 20 years old and has one child in school. Her husband works outside the city as a crab fisherman. Carmen started her business with a small loan. She makes her sales travelling around to areas close to her small wooden house. She hopes to improve and grow her business, so that she can help improve her home and better help her parents as well.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

Descripción del Negocio

Carmen inicio su negocio hace 4 años. Los productos que vende son: Prendas de vestir para niños como pantalones, blusas, bisuteria,conjuntos e interiores. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 9am-a -6pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Carmen necesita del préstamo para invertir en la compra de más y nuevos modelos de ropa .Así como también adquirir telas para elaborar conjuntos de vestir para niños. De esta manera ofrecer nueva variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Carmen tiene 20años. Tiene 1 hijo que está estudiando. Su esposo trabaja fuera de la ciudad en la recolección de cangrejos. Carmen inicio con un pequeño capital prestado .Sus ventas la realiza de manera ambulante recorriendo varios sectores cerca de su hogar. Su casa es de madera. Aspira mejorar y crecer junto con su negocio. Para de esta manera lograr brindar una mejor ayuda a su hogar y a sus padres.

loans.use: Buy more clothing for her business

loans.name: Endang

texts.en: Endang is 27 years old and married. She sells rice and some fried foods such as fried chicken, potatoes, fish, and fried snacks, as well as many other items. Her husband, Asep, is a musician in a group with a fluctuating income. Endang has been running her business since she joined MBK, and can earn $17 per day. She needs a $100 loan to buy some food and to increase her capital. She hopes that this will increase her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Sandra Evarista

texts.es:
Sandra Evarista sells clothing to wholesalers and other small businesses along the streets of Chinandega. She has been running this business for 4 years, starting with some of her own savings. Since she began working with CEPRODEL 3 years ago, she has received 12 small loans which have helped her cover basic costs for her children and family in general, while she has grown her business thanks to the loans received.

Sandra Evarista, es una mujer que su trabajo en si era Vendedor Ambulante (vendía en las calles de Chinandega), vendía Ropa al por mayor a otros pequeños Comerciantes.

Tiene cuatro años en el manejo de su negocio y su monto inical fué de C$ 8.000.00 Cordobas netos, de ese monto inicial incluye Capital propio, parte de sus ahorros.

Sandra Evarista, desde que comenzo a trabajar con Ceprodel desde hace 3 años ha obtenido 12 créditos , los cuales han sido para cubrir los gastos basicos para su hijos y familia en general.

Desde que ella comenzo a trabajar con Ceprodel la actividad de su negocio ha ido aumentando, y ahora se dedica a la Compra de Mercaderia en General, gracias a la oportunidad de crédito que obtuvo con Ceprodel.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY MORE  MERCHANDISE FOR HER CLOTHING SALES BUSINESS.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina, despite her advanced age, remains eager to progress in life. After spending her entire life in Capachica, the village where she was born, she recently decided to move. Currently she is living in a humble and somewhat remote neighborhood of the city of Juliaca, where which she continues patiently and skillfully creating her beautiful and colorful woven blankets with her hardworking and agile hands. Since she was widowed, this hardworking mother dedicated every moment to giving the best to her children, who, now that they are grown and independent, return the love, patience and attention that they received. Josefina would like to acquire more raw material in order to continue crafting her beautiful and unique blankets. With this end in mind, she is requesting a loan which she commits to repay in a period of six months. She anxiously awaits your response.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Josefina, pese a su avanzada edad sigue deseosa D. progresar en la vida, después D. pasar su vida entera en su pueblo natal, Capachica, decidió salir D. ella. Actualmente radica en un humilD. y alejado barrio D. la ciudad D. Juliaca en el que sigue elaborando muy hábil y pacientemente sus hermosas y coloridas frazadas tejidas con sus ágiles y trabajadoras manos.DesD. que quedó viuda esta trabajadora madre en todo momento trató D. brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos, ahora ellos ya mayores e independientes corresponden a su madre con el mismo amor, paciencia y atención que recibieron.El deseo D. doña Josefina es adquirir mayor cantidad D. materia prima para seguir fabricando sus hermosas y resaltantes frazadas, con ese fin hace la solicitud D. un préstamo que se compromete a retornarlo en un lapso D. seis meses.Josefina espera ansiosa tu respuesta.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger quantity and a wider variety of raw materials.

loans.name: I Made Mekir

texts.id:
I Made Mekir has planted 300 Vanilla trees in his 15 acre land since 3 years ago. It has produced one harvest, despite not too much. Last harvest, I Made Mekir produced 150kg vanilla for $4 per kg. However, vanilla trade is promising for its high price and low maintenance requirement. In one 12 month harvest cycle, a Vanilla tree requires compost fertilizer and insecticide and herbicide spray once every 3 months. In June to September, the vanilla trees starts blooming, and at this time I Made Mekir is busy to pollinate he flower to produce fruit. Vanilla does not produce without human intervention. Currently, I Made Mekir needs additional capital to pay for a contract labor to help pollenize. The pollination has to be done in one day window and the flower will wither if not pollinated on time. Lately, fertilizer and insecticide price is increasing, which makes life harder. With the loan, I Made Mekir hopes to improve his farming process to improve yield.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Di areal tanah seluas 15 are milik I Made Mekir, tumbuh dengan subur tanaman Vanili sekitar 300 pohon. Tanaman Vanili ini telah di tanam oleh I Made Mekir sejak 3 tahun yang lalu dan sudah dapat sekali panen walau hasil panennya tidak terlalu banyak. Panen yang lalu I Made Mekir mendapat Vanili sebanyak 150 Kg dan harga per kilogramnya Rp. 35.000.- / kg. Namun begitu, tanaman ini sangat menjanjikan. Di samping karena harganya yang sangat mahal, pemeliharaanya tidak terlalu sulit. Dalam satu periode panen yaitu selama 12 bulan, tanaman Vanili membutuhkan perawatan berupa pupuk yaitu pupuk kandang dan semprotan anti hama / jamur yang biasanya di lakukan setiap 3 bulan sekali. Pada bulan Juni sampai September, tanaman Vanili ini mulai berbunga dan saat itu pula I Made Mekir mulai sibuk untuk mengawinkan bunga Vanilinya agar bisa menghasilkan buah, karena tanpa bantuan manusia tanaman ini tidak dapat berproduksi . Pada masa ini pula I Made Mekir banyak membutuhkan modal untuk membayar tenaga kerja yang membantu proses perkawinan itu karena proses ini harus dilakukan dalam satu hari saja dan bunga akan gugur bila terlambat dalam mengawinkan Belakangan ini harga pupuk dan anti hama mengalami peningkatan sehingga dampaknya sangat dirasakan oleh petani. Begitu juga dengan I Made Mekir . Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, I Made Mekir berharap bisa memelihara Vanilinya lebih baik lagi dan menghasilkan buah lebih banyak .

loans.use: Purchase Fertilizer and Insecticide and Hire Contract Labor

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr:
Amy Cissé is 51 years old, is married and a mother of 3 children. She is a member of the Tiléne Daraal village bank in the Ziguinchor area. She has always respected her engagements with the bank. Amy would like to buy rice bags and oil cans to restock her canteen and to diversify her products in order to satisfy her clients. The income drawn from this trade helps her take care of her 3 children and 2 grandchildren. She is asking for a 14th loan which will be refunded in 6 months in only one installment.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Amy Cissé, 51ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants est membre du banc villageois de Tiléne Daraal à Ziguinchor.Elle a toujours respecté ses engagements. Amy veut acheter des sacs de riz et des bidons d'huile pour renforcer sa cantine et diversifier ses produits afin de satisfaire sa clientèle.Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d'entretenir ses 03 enfants et ses 02 petits fils qui sont à sa charge. Elle sollicite un 14ème prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de 06 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy rice and oil to restock her canteen.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en: Faten is 41 years old and has three children. She lives with her family in southern Lebanon, in the town of Saida, where she runs a grocery store. Faten has applied for her third loan from A. Majmoua. She plans to use the money to buy additionA. merchandise to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
In order to better her health, Felicia decided to sell homemade meals from her home. She decided to install cable television so that she can attrack more clientele and hopefully increase her daily earnings. Due to her poor health and old age, she needs to buy some vitamins to make her feel better. With the support of her partner and older children, she's able to buy the medicine she needs for her ailments. Felicia's biggest wish is not only to improve her health, but to open up a restaurant and make it one of the best restaurants in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Con el deseo de establecer su salud, Felicia trata de aumentar sus ventas en su negocio de comida y como un estrategia de venta instaló en su domicilio un cable televisivo para atraer a la clientela, siendo este un beneficio que la ayuda a poder aumentar el número de pensionistas y por ende el aumento de sus ingresos diarios.Sin embargo siempre tiene esos malestares propios de su edad y requiere de algunas vitaminas para mejorar su salud y gracias al apoyo de su pareja y de sus hijos mayores puede acceder de los medicamentos que requiere. Pero el deseo de Felicia va mas allá de establecer su salud y desea ambientar su restaurante y convertir a su negocio en la más concurrido de su comunidad.

loans.use: To open up a restaurant

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy E. sells clothing material. She is married, but her husband's income from his own sales is not sufficient for Dorothy and her two children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business selling clothing materials.

loans.name: Ana Antonia

texts.en:
Ana Antonia is a member of the Ccori Soncco Village Bank (meaning Gold Heart in Quechua, the native language of Peru).

Ana Antonia is a married 28-year-old mother of two children. Ana Antonia makes biscochos and chapla (tradional bread of the region) using her mother´s oven and the help of her brothers and sisters. They sell their bread by cart in the Santa Clara market in the afternoons. Furthermore, Ana Antonia sells food and cake by special order to her clients. Ana Antonia has a current project to buy materials and build her house.

Ana Antonia needs a loan of 1200 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($450 USD) that she will invest in part to pay for her housing construction.

Ana Antonia´s dream is to have her own bread shop, learn more about breadmaking, and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: Ana Antonia needs a loan that she will invest in part to pay for her housing construction.

loans.name: Serng

texts.en:
Mr. Serng S. is 27 years old bricklayer. He lives in Omperl Commune, Siem Reap Province. His wife, Mrs. Choeun Sat is a 26-year-old farmer. S. and his wife live with two children, both of whom are too young and to attend school. Everyday S. spends a lot for traveling to work and therefore he wants to reduce travel expenses and save the money for his family’s support.

S. would like to request a loan $550 to purchaS. a motorcycle to uS. for traveling to work. S. plans to uS. the remainder of the loan to purchaS. fertilizer to uS. for his wife's vegetable crops. The loan will help expand their business and hopefully increaS. their income.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use as traveling to work

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila Nooren baji, the widow of F. H. Shahzad, lives in Kausr, Pakistan, a city famous for its sweetmeats and its decorative embroidery. She is the mother of four children, three sons and one daughter, all enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. 

Having completed her education until 14th standard, she has concentrated on household work and taking care of her children since the death of her husband.  Shumailia baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for a loan to buy merchandise (soaps, toothpaste, and shampoos) for her elder brother, shown on the right in the photo, a wholesaler by profession.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario es un joven que  trabaja sembrado yerbas medicinales para llevarlas a las ciudades y venderlas, estas plantas son muy buscadas por ser altamente útiles para curar algunas dolencias, fiebres y males estomacales.  Es así, que ya hace un año está dedicado a la producción de estas yerbas, juntamente cultiva otros productos agrícolas en su chacra.  Este trabajo esta basado en el amor que siente por sus padres, desea ayudarlos a pagar los gastos educativos de sus hermanos, además de iniciar su independización, para más adelante formar su propia familia con su prometida quien es una joven muy trabajadora al igual que Mario.  Es por estas razones desea incrementar su producción, y dedicarse a la producción de productos más rentables, para ello requiere de un préstamo para iniciar la siembra de papa.  Tu contribución será importante para Mario, podrá no sólo ayudar a sus padres, sino que también podrá casarse con su pareja.
texts.en:
Mario is a young man who works planting medicinal herbs in order to take them to cities and sell them. These plants are highly sought after because they are very useful in curing certain ailments, fevers, and upset stomachs. For the past year, he has been producing these herbs along with cultivating other agricultural products grown on his farm. This work is based on the love he feels for his parents, and he wants to help them pay the educational expenses of his brothers. In addition, he wants to begin his own independence in order to start his own family with his fiancée, who is a hard-working young woman like Mario, in the future. It is for these reasons he wants to increase his production and to focus on producing more profitable products. In order to be able to do this, Mario needs a loan to start planting potatoes. Your contribution will be important for Mario; not only will it help his parents, but it would also enable Mario to marry his partner.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital to starting planting potatoes on his land, in order to help his parents and to get married soon.

loans.name: Ta's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of four members who live in Pou Village in Takeo province. Mrs. Ta O., who is 31 years old, is the group's leader, and she is a vegetable farmer. She owns a small piece of land, where she is able to generate a small amount of income. Now, she wants to expand her business operations, so she is seeking a loan to add to her savings and to eventually buy another piece of land in order to cultivate more vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Sao Sin, is a laborer who earns a small amount of income to support their household. In addition, they have one child, who is also a laborer.

These four group members are seeking end-of-term loans, which do not obligate borrowers to repay any principal on their loans until the end of the loans' term. Notably, end-of-term loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor population. Specifically, such loans allow borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Even so, most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term, and nearly all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. In fact, AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional farmland in order to cultivate more vegetables

loans.name: Julian Alberto

texts.es: El señor Julián  es una persona joven pero también padre de familia y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable dentro y fuera de su casa, su esposa la señora Leonor es quien lo apoya y juntos como familia unida están solicitando este crédito para realizar la construcción de la barda  dando mayor seguridad a su casa.
texts.en:
Julian is a young man but he is also a family man. He has shown himself to be a responsible person inside and out of the home. His wife, Leonor, is his support and together as a unified family they are requesting a loan to build a wall, thereby providing greater safety to their home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall around their home.

loans.name: Norma Noemi

texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Amaqella Village Bank. Amaqella means “Don’t be lazy” in Quechua. Norma is 46 years old and is married with three children. Norma sells clothing and pajamas, mostly for women and children. She started her business 15 years ago, when she first began working with FINCA Peru. She sells door-to-door and also takes special orders from her clients.

Norma is requesting a loan of 2100 soles to buy yellow clothing for the New Year’s season (in Peru, it is considered good luck to ring in the New Year wearing yellow clothing or underwear). Her goal for the future is to obtain more investment capital so that she can open her own boutique to sell trendy clothes.

loans.use: To buy yellow clothing to sell for New Year's.

loans.name: Mchakato Group

texts.en:
Margaret M., age 37, is married with two children, ages 15 and 17.  She has a grocery where she sells only drinks. She started this business three years ago and works daily from 8am until 11pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $729. 

This will be Margret’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the stock of her grocery and has repaid the loans successfully. She now hopes for a second loan to start selling food.
\t
Margaret will share this loan with her loan group, Mchakato, which totals 15 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Margaret is second from the right.

loans.use: To start selling food products

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đinh Thị B. năm nay 46 tuổi, chị tham gia quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999. Ban đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và mua xe ngựa để chồng đi chở hàng thuê. Đến năm 2004, gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn để thu mua phế liệu và giặt bao bì bán. Đây cũng là  những công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng. Trong thời gian tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua  thêm máy giặt bao bì nhằm tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dinh Thi B. is 46 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 1999. Initially she borrowed money to invest in livestock and bought a horse-drawn carriage for her husband to do transportation service. In 2004, her family invested money in buying scrap materials and washing packaging bags to resell. These businesses bring the main source of income of her family with an income of VND5,000,000 per month. In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND15,000,000 to buy packaging bag washing machine to get extra income for her family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy packaging bag washing machine

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mrs. An C., 64, is widowed with one daughter. They live in a small village along National Road Number 5, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

An has been selling fish for 28 years; she buys them from the kilometer number 9 market for resale at the Prek Phnao market. Her daughter helps her in the business. An is requesting her second loan of $1000 to maintain the land around her house.

loans.use: To maintain the land her house.

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.en:
O. Rustamjon is 38 years old and a married father of four children, two of whom currently attend school. He owns a shop in which he sells spare moped engine parts, a business he has been running for the last 20 years. The income he earns allows him to pay for his children’s education.

To meet his customers’ constantly growing demand, Rustamjon would like to increase his shop’s capacity. The profits from these sales will allow him to continue to send his children to school and to improve his living conditions. The loan will greatly improve Rustamjon’s income and his family's living standards.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Belnais

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 44-year-old Belnais W Z. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children between the ages of 5 and 17. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. Belnais has been running a café business. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces.

She works at the business for 13 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by two employees. Belnais currently earns about US $300 from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase ingredients in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business. Belnais thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her cafe in bulk.

loans.name: Mrs. Phalla Tuy Village Bank Group

texts.en: Ten people living in TrapE. Trayueng village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan group. They will use this loan for various purposes. Mrs. Phalla T. is the 37 year old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a one hectare field of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Kheav Phally, is a Tok Tok taxi driver (motorized bicycle taxi). Although they try to work hard they still don’t earn enough income to support their family. In order to improve their living situation, Mrs. Phalla T. has decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food and piglets to breed. She hopes to increase their income and improve her family’s living conditions with this loan. She has four children, one of whom is employed while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy pig food and piglets to breed.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 47 years old and is married with a child. She sells gravel and sand. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sand and gravel to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sand and gravel to sell

loans.name: Comité Millenium Group

texts.en:
The Millennium committee started after the breaking up of another committee in the area. After canceling the credit, many of the women decided to get together again, despite the errors and wrongdoings of the previous committee, and began to start their work again.

The women in the committee work selling articles in the neighborhood where they live, from their respective homes as well as going door to door to offer their products. They are from the Santa María zone of San Lorenzo. The average loan that each one receives is 384,210 Gs, which will be invested in the purchase of articles for sale. 

Marina M. ..... Newspaper sales 
Francisca F. ..... Lottery ticket sales 
María C. ..... Small convenience store 
Olga A. ..... Small convenience store 
Petrona F. ..... Clothing sales 
Lida A. ..... Clothing sales 
Cirila B. ..... Lottery ticket sales 
Evelia F. ..... Newspaper sales 
Rosalina Q. ..... Charcoal sales 
Ursulina C. ..... Fruit sales 
Pamela G. ..... Clothing sales 
Dora F. ..... Fruit sales 
Lucia G. ..... Dressmaker 
Gladys B. ..... Newspaper 
Elsa G. ..... Food sales 
Rosa C. ..... Clothing sales 
Ana V. ..... Clothing sales 
María P. ..... Gift shop 
Luz P. ..... Clothing sales

loans.use: To purchase items for sale

loans.name: Man Maiya

texts.en:
Man Maiya B. is a resident of Bhaishipati. Bhaishipati is one the developing villages of lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Mrs. Man Maiya B. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter). Her son is studying in grade 9 and her daughter is in grade 6.

Both Man Maiya B. and her husband are engaged in agricultural work. They own piece of land and they grow green vegetables on their land. They grow seasonal vegetables on their land due to their lack of modern tools and technology. They sell their vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening.

Now Mrs. B. is requesting a loan of Rs 10,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow vegetables in the monsoon season.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa tiene 50 años, esta casada con el Sr. Hernan verduguez, llevan 28 años de casados, tiene tres hijas, todas viven con ella. La mayor ayuda a la Sra. Rosa en el cuidado y en la alimentacion de las vacas lecheras, las otras dos acuden a la Universidad Mayor de San Simon.

La Sra. Rosa se dedica a la produccion de leche durante 30 años. Empezo a trabajar independientemente desde que era muy joven. Toda la produccion de leche entrega diariamente a una empresa local que elabora toda clase de productos lacteos. Necesita el prestamo para poder comprar mas alimento para su ganado lechero por que ya no tiene mucho. 

La Sra. Rosa quiere mejorar su produccion de leche. En un futuro desea comprar mas vacas lecheras para incrementar su produccion y asi mejorar sus ingresos para poder ayudar a sus hijas en el estudio.
texts.en:
Rosa, 50, has been married to Hernan Verdugues for 38 years. They have three daughters who live with them. The oldest helps Rosa take care of and feed the dairy cows. The other two attend the Universidad Mayor in San Simon. Rosa has been working in milk production for 30 years. She started to work independently when she was very young. Every day she takes all of her milk production to a local business that makes all kinds of dairy products. She needs the loan to be able to buy food for her dairy cows because they do not have much now. Rosa wants to improve her milk production. In the future she wishes to buy more dairy cows to increase her production and improve her income. Then she will be able to help her daughters with their education

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food for dairy cows

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana A. is from the village of Bato. She is 57 years old. Ana is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Ana owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ana has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Ana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Ana is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and seedlings to grow. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Ana from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and seedlings

loans.name: Los Canastitos Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Canastitos es originario de la Ciudad de Monimbó-Masaya; cuyo  poblado está situado a una legua de Masaya. De todas las poblaciones que eran grupos chorotegas, sólo Monimbó ha mantenido la identidad étnica a través de tiempo. Se destaca por su producción de artesanías en palma y en cuero y por su raíz Folklórica.

La coordinadora del grupo es doña María de los Ángeles de 39 años de edad, trabaja en costura, negocio que inició hace varios años cuando se salió de de la Zona Franca, donde había trabajado, y con su liquidación decidió comprar una máquina de coser para iniciar su propio taller de costura.

Su crédito lo requiere para invertir en la compra de materiales y poco a poco ir ampliando su taller, y que de esta manera sus hijas aprendan a trabajar y puedan estudiar valiéndose de ésta herramienta para salir adelante.

Doña Rosa Adela T. trabaja en la elaboración de comidas y frescos en su casa y doña Ana Julia S. trabaja como costurera en su hogar.
texts.en:
The Canastitos Group originates from the city of Monimbó-Masaya, which is located one league (about 3 miles) away from Masaya. Of all the populations that descended from the Chorotega group, only the Monimbó have been able to maintain their ethnic identity over time. This is evident in the production of handcrafts made of palm leaves and leather which are rooted in folklore.

Doña María de los Ángeles is the group coordinator. She is 39 years old and works as a seamstress. She started her business several years ago when she left the Franca District, where she worked previously. Using the settlement payment from her old employer, she decided to buy a sewing machine so that she could open her own tailoring workshop.

She will use her loan to purchase materials and gradually expand her workshop. Her children will be able to work and study at the same time in order to get ahead.

Doña Rosa Adela T. works from home preparing and selling meals and beverages. Doña Ana Julia S. also works from home as a seamstress.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials in order to increase output

loans.name: Karoline

texts.en:
Karoline M. is a 30 year-old woman living in the town of Samatau 3.  She is married and has 1 school-aged child.  To make a living, Karoline owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members.  Karoline has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 350 Tala WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Karoline joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Karoline is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD.    Karoline is now requesting a new loan of 1000 Tala WST which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide services. Karoline plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide services

loans.name: Toeung

texts.en: Toeung S., 47, is a widow living in the Takeo province with her two children. She sells dessert and is supported by one of the children who work in the garment factory. Toeung S. is asking for a loan of US$400 to make a new investment. She will buy perfume items and resell it for a profit.

loans.use: buy perfume items

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
“Wise use of capital is necessary to achieve success in business and life” said by Elena P.. She is 37 years of age and a married person. She’s living in the village of San Fabian Echague with her husband and two children: Cyver Guillar-5 years of age and the youngest is Julianne Faye-2 years old. This family is happily and peacefully lives in their village.
	Elena is managing a general store business within their village. Her husband is a vendor of rice and her helper in managing their store. They both work hard for their children’s needs. Elena hopes that she could expand her store and buy additional groceries. But sad to say because she have insufficient capital that’s why she would like to borrow to the KIVA lenders additional capital amounting of PHP5,000. This would serve a big help to them most especially to their business expansion.

loans.use: additional capital for her store

loans.name: Mrs. Phors Mouk Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phors M. is a pig breeder. She is 25 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Reth Chhoen, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still do not earn enough income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Phors M. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and fertilizer. She will use the rest of the money to buy ice-creA. to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's standard of living with this loan.

Mrs. Phors M. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Mrs. San Nhorn is the group guarantor and she is also present in the picture with the village bank group. This village bank loan includes 17 people and they all live in Chhuon Srey village in TaK. province.

loans.use: To buy piglets, fertilizers and ice-cream to resell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hard working mother.  She is 59 years old and operates her sari-sari store business (a community-based store). She is selling different kinds of goods and basic commodities in their village at Sinamar, Roxas, Isabela.

She is already a widow and was left with three children.  Being a mother and father to her children is difficult and this is the reason why she needs to work hard to provide the needs of her family.  However, due to a lack of financial resources, she was not able to send her children to school to pursue their college education.

At present, she would like to borrow additional business capital from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 6,000.  This amount will be used to purchase grocery items for the improvement of her business and to offer more goods to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her store

loans.name: Bibirajab

texts.en: J. Bibirajab is the married mother of one adult son. She runs a small business selling men’s shoes and clothes in the local market and has been involved in this trade for eighteen years. Bibirajab recently moved her vending facility to a different location which has promoted an increase in her sales. Bibirajab has many loyal customers. She is very friendly and amiable with each client, thus giving her a unique talent in attracting new customers. Bibirajab purchases clothing wholesale every week. She is hoping to use the loan of 1,500 USD to purchase winter clothes and shoes for men. She hopes to see her venture grow big enough to afford to buy a new vending facility in the future. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase winter clothes and shoes for men

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en: Marwan has owned an electric repair shop in his town since 2000. He is a 38-year-old married man with four children who all go to school. Today, Marwan is asking to borrow $1,200 to purchase a Rapid (name of a make or model of car) car which will facilitate his business travel to satisfy his clients’ demands.

loans.use: to purchase a "Rapid" car

loans.name: Fretzel Liza

texts.en: Fretzel Liza B. is from the village of Banonong. She is 38 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Fretzel Liza owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP average per month. In 2008, Fretzel Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store business. Fretzel Liza is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies for her pig-raising activity. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children’s education. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mario Francisco

texts.es: El señor Mario Francisco S. V., es casado y viven en el Bo. las Conchitas y su esposa trabaja como docente y le apoya con los gastos del hogar y con el negocio, ellos tienen 3 hijos, dos de ellos son mayores de edad, viven y trabajan de manera independiente, como familia a futuro planean la reconstruccion de su hogar para que la hija mayor habite con sus hijos. El señor  S. se ha dedicado desde hace 11 años a la venta de abarrotes y lacteos,el es dueño de una pulperia que les ha brindado el sustento dia a dia, es para este negocio que solicitó el prestamo para invertirlo en la compra de productos que le abastescan el local y les aumente los ingresos, esto les ayudará a enfrentar la enfermedad que aqueja al hijo ,es por él que la familia tiene como objetivo el empeño diario para sobrellevar los gastos del menor.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario Francisco S. V. is married and lives in the Las Conchitas district. His wife works as a teacher and helps with the expenses of the home and with the business. They have 3 children, two of whom are adults who work and live independently. As a family, they plan to add on to their house in the future, so that their oldest daughter can live there with her children.

Mr. S. has worked for the past 11 years selling groceries and dairy products. He is the owner of a small grocery store that has provided for their day to day needs. It is for this business that he requested a loan to use to buy products to stock the store and increase earnings. This will help them to deal with their son's illness. The family's motivation for their daily efforts is to be able to deal with their young son's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to stock his grocery store

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa B. is a single woman who supports her family by running a general store. She lives in Barangay Binicuil Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 45,000.

Adelfa B. is now borrowing PHP 20,500 so that she can increase inventory levels in her general store. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Adelfa B. aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and to ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Falateza

texts.en: Falateza V. is currently in the business of selling cooked food in her hotel (restaurant) and is requesting a loan to stock soft drinks like sodas, boxed juice, water, etc., to sell. Falateza is 32 years old and is married to a soldier. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy a stock soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 48 years old and married with five children aged between 8 and 18 years. All her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a three-room house where she stays with four people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home.  The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees for her children, medication and feeding the family. Susan owns a small eating joint in Kitawuluzi selling all types of traditional food. She buys foodstuffs from Owino market, one of the city markets, and so she incurs transport costs to and from shopping. She receives an average of 10 customers a day. She has done this business for over 10 years. Her main challenges are defaulters and the rainy season because she works from a muddy place. She works on a retail basis only. She has been with MCDT for over seven years, servicing her 16th loan working all along with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas and cassava. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and own a big hotel. 
.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her resturant

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace O. is from the village of Tabo-o near Jimenez in Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Grace is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  Grace is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Grace operates a fishing business buying and selling fish, and she earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Grace joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Grace is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Grace from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her fish business.

loans.name: Sa Em

texts.en: Mrs. Sa Em O. is a 37-year-old married woman who lives in Tonle Village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sokong Long, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living for their family. Aside from being farmers, they are also rice middlemen who can earn a small income to improve their family's living conditions. They have a rice mill machine for this business, but they do not have enough money to buy enough rice to grow their business. Thus, Mrs. Sa Em O. decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to sell. This couple has two children who are students in the local school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more rice

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco  es una persona proactiva y emprendedora a sus 68 años, es casado, tiene 4 hijos todos ellos independientes, trabaja con EDAPROSPO prosperidad desde hace 5 años, se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares (cuadernos, libros, lapiceros, etc.),  además realiza filmaciones y fotos en eventos, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado dar una mejor educación a sus hijos, mejorar su calidad de vida y el acabado de su vivienda. 
El gran sueño de Francisco, es seguir creciendo con su negocio y apoyar a su familia. El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido en la compra mercadería (útiles escolares). Francisco se encuentra muy agradecido por todo el apoyo brindado, porque le ha ayudado  a salir adelante y a prosperar con su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco is a proactive and enterprising 68-year-old married father of 4 grown children. He has been working with EDAPROSPO Prosperidad for 5 years. He sells school supplies (notebooks, books, pencils, etc.) for a living. Additionally, he provides video and photography services at special events. With his daily efforts, he has managed to provide his children with an education, improve his quality of life, and complete his home.

Francisco's biggest dream is to keep expanding his business and to support his family. This loan will be used to purchase merchandise: school supplies. Francisco is very grateful for all the support that he has been given because it has helped him and his family get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva P. is from the village of Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 45 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Silva owns and operates a clothing business, selling used clothes to local community members. She goes to the city and buys ready to wear used clothing and peddles it in her village. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Silva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Silva is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Azeem's Group

texts.en:
Azeem, a resident of Lahore, famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods, is the wife of M. I. and owns a small house of two rooms in which she has been living with her family for over 30 years. 

A very caring lady, Azeem manages her domestic chores and takes care of her family very efficiently. Her husband operates a DVD selling business. He sells the veritable DVD and movie tapes. His variety in items helps him to approach more customers in his shop. He is very active in his work. He writes the demands of his customers in a notepad and arranges them on an urgent basis, which gives a nice impression to its customers. He has been doing this work for over 10 years. 

Azeem is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase  more DVDs and movie tapes and complete the order of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase DVDs and Movie tapes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en:
Mr. Koeun S. (pictured above), 37, and his wife, Mrs. Bo Klang, 32, have been married since 2003 and have two children: one son and one daughter, both still young. They live in a small village along National Road Number Four about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Koeun has been a construction worker for ten years, while his wife has been a garment factory worker for five years. Their house needs repairs, but he does not have the money and so is requesting his first loan for $500 for that purpose.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El Comité Niño Jesús es un excelente  comité conformado en fecha 12 de Junio del 2010, integrado por 15 mujeres muy trabajadoras. En este momento se encuentra trabajando muy contentas dentro del 2° ciclo del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. 
Las integrantes de este grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades dependiendo de las herramientas y facilidades con que cuentan. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Alcira quien se dedica a elaboración y venta de comestibles.
Con esta actividad ella obtiene ingreso diario y de esta forma le ayuda a su marido para los gasto de la familia.
Los comestibles que ella prepara los vende frente a su casa en una casilla que ella tiene.
Ella además de los comestibles también expone el trabajo de ao poi (artesanía en telas) de las demás integrantes del comité para ayudar con las ventas.
Ella solicita por su parte el crédito para la compra de ingredientes de los comestibles que ella prepara así como:
Carne de vacuna, porcino, y de pollo, también aceites, saborizantes, verduras, y otros.
texts.en:
The “Niño Jesús” (Child Jesus) committee is an excellent committee that was established on 12 June 2010. It is made up of 15 hard-working women. They are currently working in the second cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women) committee’s program. The members of this group are involved in a variety of commercial activities depending on the tools and abilities they have. One of the members is Alcira who prepares meals for sale. This activity produces daily income with which she helps her husband support the family. The meals she prepares she sells in front of her house in a small booth. Besides the meals she also displays works in ao poi (fine fabric crafts) that the other group members make in order to help with sales. She is asking for funds to buy ingredients like pork, beef, chicken, cooking oil, spices, vegetables, etc., for the meals she prepares.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients like: chicken, beef, pork, spices, etc.

loans.name: Rita Anielka

texts.es: Rita Anielka tiene 27 años, su actividad económica es la venta de tortillas. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, ella tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, por lo que se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para iniciar sus labores del hogar y empezar con la elaboración de tortillas, pues sus inicios se dieron con la intención de buscar nuevos ingresos, por lo que no tenía un empleo para seguir adelante y necesitaba generar ingresos. Es la primera vez que realiza financiamiento y se encuentra contenta. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de maíz, cal, leña y tortillas. Sueña con agrandar su negocio y establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
Rita Anielka is 27 years old. Her economic activity is selling tortillas. She has had this business for over four years. She has 1 child and she gets up at 5 o'clock in the morning to do the housework and to start making the tortillas. She began the business seeking more income, since she didn't have a job and needed to make money. This is the first time that she has taken out a loan and she is happy. The loan will be used to buy corn, lime, and firewood. Her dream is to expand her busines and open a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Narangerel is 33 years old, married, and has a 12-year-old son and a 6-year-old daughter. Currently they live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. 

During this summer she and her husband built a 48 square meter wooden house on their piece of land. The reason she is asking for this loan is they plan to finish the internal decorations and to move in to their newly built house before winter comes. 

Narangerel used to work in a clothing factory and was left jobless because the factory closed down. Then she started her own tailoring business and employs two tailors, paying them 150,000 Mongolian tugrug (MNT) a month each. She makes protective clothing such as gloves and overalls and sells them in the market. She rents two stalls in "Harhorin" the second largest market in Ulaanbaatar city and sells garments as well.
