She is very hard-working, enthusiastic person. Her future plan is to expand her business and to give a good education to her kids.

loans.use: Finishing internal decorations for newly built house

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: la sra. Maria del Carmen M.  se dedica al comercio cuenta con una tienda que opera bajo el nombre de pulperia MARYCARMEN y esta ubicada en su casa de habitación en el barrio Las Flores de la ciudad de El Paraíso, cuenta con mas de 6 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio, Maria lo administra personalmente y durante todo este tiempo le ha ido muy bien pues nos comentaba que del negocio paga los gastos familiares y compromisos adquiridos, a la vez cuenta con 2 manzanas de finca de café cosechero permitiéndole tener otras fuentes de ingresos. El credito lo utilizara para surtir mejor su negocio y que sus ventas sean mejores para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen is a merchant who has a general store, operating under the name 'Pulpería MARYCARMEN'. It is located in her house in Las Flores (The Flowers) barrio, in the city of El Paraíso (The Paradise). She has more than 6 years of experience in running her business. Maria administers it personally and during all this time, things have gone well. She comments that the business pays for the family's expenses and obligations. At the same time, Maria has a farm with 3 ½ acres of coffee that can be harvested, giving her an added source of income. The loan will be used to better supply the business, increasing sales and improving the conditions of life for Maria and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CREAMS, SHAMPOOS, HAIR CONDITIONERS, SOFT DRINKS, TOILET PAPER, SANITARY NAPKINS, SOAPS, BATTERIES, CANDLES, HAIR GEL, Q-TIPS, NAIL POLISH, DEODORANTS, BREAD, TOOTH PASTE, RAZORS, ETC

loans.name: Vangeline

texts.en:
Vangeline S. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Vangeline owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Vangeline also harvests coconuts from her coconut trees. 

Vangeline joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Vangeline is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers. This will be the second loan taken out by Vangeline from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en: Purevsuren D. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife is employed as a nurse in a local organization, and two of their children attend a local school. Purevsuren makes a variety of wood products and furniture. He started this business in 1995 and has since made quality furnishings for the people of his province. Over his many years in business, he has gained a lot of experience and has a large customer base. Purevsuren also operates a taxi service and repairs cars to supplement his earnings. He is a very modest and business-minded person. He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to buy more wood for making furniture.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Batsuuri

texts.en:
Batsuuri D., age 41, lives with his wife and two daughters in Baganuur, one of the remote districts of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. He and his family live in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian housing tent. 

Batsuuri and his wife operate a clothing and consumer goods trade business in their community. They provide a variety of clothing items and consumer goods to satisfy their customers' needs. They have been operating their shop in a rented space after moving from countryside. After only a short period of operation, they have have attained success in their new business and have built up a stable operation. In the future, they plan to expand their shop by renting a larger-sized space in which to do business. Their earnings have enabled them to improve their family's standard of living.  

Batsuuri is a very modest and hardworking person. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of clothes and goods at wholesale prices from Narantuul, a large, main market in Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothes and goods for sale

loans.name: Theresa Aba Atom

texts.en: Theresa Aba Atom N. bakes bread at Elmina. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a security man. She has junior high educational background. Theresa assists her husband in feeding, clothing and educating her dependents. She is requesting the loan to buy more ingredients to bake bread for distribution. The additional income she generates will be used to further her children’s education.

loans.use: buy more ingredients to use to bake bread for distribution

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and house rent bills.

She has operated a charcoal and coconut selling business for over five years, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. Mwanatumu faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting charcoal from the forest to the urban areas for resale. She hopes to expand and purchase a tuktuk (three-wheel taxi) in the future.

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase fifteen bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 48 years old, married, and the mother of nine aged between 10-30 years old, with seven attending school. For thirty years she has been in dairy farming and sells her milk locally. She also buys milk from other farmers and sells by transporting it by donkey.  She has one employee.

She has applied for this loan of 45,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow, which will improve the milk production, thus increasing income. 
The challenges she experiences is sourcing for a good cow and lack of clean water. She is happy with Juhudi for its easy loan advances.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Welinton Eduardo

texts.es:
Welinton Eduardo A. M. tiene 45 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALL PARAISO se encuentra ubicada 120 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Welinton se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Matilde Esther y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos y construir una vivienda.

Le gusta tener amigos.
texts.en:
Welinton Eduardo A. M., 45, is married living with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  He has five children.

The members of the VALL PARAISO communal bank are located 120 minutes from the Chillanes Office.  It is part of Chillanes canton and the bank is dedicated to short cycle cocoa bean farming.  They have been in this line of work for a long time.

Welinton has been farming cocoa beans for two years.  He buys his supplies in Matilde Esther and sells his products in the Chillanes market and in his own settlement.

He is asking for funds to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for the cocoa bean crops.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and weather changes.  His dream is to buy land and build a house.

He likes having friends.

loans.use: For farming supplies and fertilizers for the cocoa bean crops.
